loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Shirley is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 51 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.

Cerila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cerila has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from selling bananas.

Cerila aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda tiene 48 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, vive con sus hijos y nuera. Vive en casa propia. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad rural dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Erlinda se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace 15 años en su casa ubicada en CPM. Nuevo mexico de cayalti. Además, vende alimentos preparados (tamales). El destino del crédito es para inversión en compra de animales y mejora de corrales. Así, mejorará la calidad de crianza de animales, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 48 years old, she is married and lives in her own house with her children and her daughter in law. They are a very close family.

She lives in a rural community in the Cayaltí district of Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast. The local economy is based in commerce, agriculture and animal production.

Erlinda has been making a living rearing and selling animals in her house for 15 years. She also sells prepared meals (tamale).

The intended use of the loan is to buy animals and make their pens better. This way, rearing quality will be improved, which will quickly lead to a better income, more profit and therefore an improvement in her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy animals and improve their pens

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 41 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos adolescentes, sin embargo no estudian por problemas económicos y la distancia de trasladarse de la comunidad de KOOM Rio Coco al municipio de Waspam, localizada a 60 km, equivalente a 3 horas. Cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años de ser docente. Solicita financiamiento para comprar un terreno. Con los dos créditos anteriores, le permitieron mejorar la vivienda de sus padres en la comunidad de KOOM. Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda en el municipio de Waspam y establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
Margarita is originally from Waspam. She is 41 years old, married and has six teenage children. Unfortunately, they cannot go to school because of their difficult financial situation and the long distance separating their community, KOOM Rio Coco, and Waspam (it takes them three hours to travel 60 km [37 miles]). She has been a teacher for six years.

Margarita is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land. With the two previous loans, she was able to help her parents, who live in KOOM, to make some home improvements. Her dream is to own a house in Waspam and open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Solano

texts.es:
Solano tiene 25 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y su hija, en el caserío de lisinas en el distrito de Pucará, dedicado al comercio de cerveza, su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Solano se dedica al comercio de cerveza, desde hace 2 años, en el caserío Lisinas. El destino del crédito es para invertir en la compra de una cantidad mayor de cerveza. Con la compra incrementará las ventas ya que la casa Solano se encuentra al costado del campo deportivo y los fines de semana son los días que tiene mayor venta. Solano posee conocimientos en el negocio. Atendiendo toda la demanda Solano podrá aumentar sus ventas, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Solano is 25 years old and lives with his spouse and daughter in the village of Lisinas in the Pucará district.  He makes a living selling beer.  His community is mostly engaged in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade.  It is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.  

Solano has made a living selling beer in Lisinas for 2 years.  The loan will go towards investing in a larger supply of beer.  This will allow him to increase his sales since the Solano home is located next to a sports field and sales are best on the weekends.  Solano knows this business well.  He can increase his sales by meeting the all of the demand for his product, which will allow him to boost his revenue in the short-term and increase his profits, therefore improving the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to invest in a larger supply of beer

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos dependientes. Vive con su madre y su hermano menor. Elmer vive en el distrito de Pucará, el cual es un distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, en dicho distrito la poblacion se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz siendo este el de mayor producción, asi como al comercio en general. Dicho distrito está ubciado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Elmer se dedica a la cria y comercio de animales de corral como son cuyes, gallinas, y cerdos, cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro, por lo que cuenta con bastante clientela en la zona, además Elmer se desempeña como peón agricola y cuenta con un corral amplio para dicha actividad cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio para la compra de animales para cria y arreglo de corral de cria. Invirtiendo en su negocio y podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptale para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer, 31, is single and has no children. He lives with his mother and his youngest brother. Elmer lives in the Pucará district, which is a medium-sized municipality fighting to get ahead. Locals work in commerce and agriculture, especially growing rice. This district is located in the Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Elmer raises and sells farm animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. He is experienced, so he has many customers. Elmer also works as a farmhand and has a big pen for his agricultural activities. He has good personal references.

Elmer will use the loan to buy animals and repair the pen where he raises them. By investing in his business, he will make better profits and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animals and repair the pen where he raises them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare his farm for planting

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz: Es una señora amable, originaria de Waspam, tiene 50 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos: 4 mayores de edad e independientes y el menor de 19 años que estudia su carrera universitaria. Es enfermera. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda, solicita su segundo financiamiento para construir su vivienda de concreto, comprar materiales de construcción: Hierro, cemento, arena, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a kind, 50-year-old woman from Waspam who works as a nurse. She is married and has five children. Four of them are of legal age and live by themselves. The youngest is 19 years old and is studying in college.

In order to improve her housing conditions, she requests her second loan to build her house in concrete. She will use the loan to buy building materials (such as cement, sand, nails and iron beams) and to cover labour expenses.

Her dream is to have a house that offers proper living conditions.

loans.use: to build her house in concrete

loans.name: Mayumi

texts.en:
Mayumi earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services.  She is 56 years old, married, and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. She is now well known for the nice quality of services she has offered for 23 years. She has already purchased some new manicure sets and able to save from it.  Her services are self-sustainable and have become profitable, with a net profit of about Php 3,000 per month. 

Mayumi wants to generate more income; she is seeking a Php 6,000 loan.  She would like to use the loan as working capital to start her snack vending business; she will purchase raw ingredients. 

Mayumi is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to start her snack vending business

loans.name: Ma. Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Ma. Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Ma. Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Ma. Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Novenia

texts.en:
Novenia is 20 years old, and married woman with one kid. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Novenia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Novenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
Dometila is 56 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dometila runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dometila has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items like sardines, soft drinks, bread, diapers, and other miscellaneous items.

In the future she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling coconut in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from bread retailing.  Susana is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more coconut stock to sell to customers.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut stock.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 28 years old and married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   

Mary Ann has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like curtains, towels, pants, and slippers to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like curtains, towels, pants, and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 36 years old, married, and has one child.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Marites has been raising livestock for ten years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
This is Clarita. She previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She will also use loan to expand her feather duster business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Clarita hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She also dreams of a good future ahead for her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities like growing, caring, and harvesting, and earning income as well. Wilma has supported her husband doing this type of work. 

Like a farmer, Wilma has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase farm equipment, farm inputs, and seedlings that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. 

Someday, Wilma hopes to purchase another farm land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase farm equipment, farm inputs and seedlings

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a resident of Tondo Manila, Philippines. She is 41 years old, and she is happily married to Ronald. They have been blessed with two children, who are already studying. Life, indeed, is hard. But by the grace of God, they have been able to raise their children well, and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Veronica owns a variety store. This kind of small store can be owned by anyone in the community, and the store is connected to, or just inside, their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, an egg, or other small items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a low price; then she will sell them by the piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby, and the people in the community. She earns PHP 1,000 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Veronica dreams of expanding her store. She also desires to save for her children's future. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 49 years old; he lives in Tuyabang Proper, Oroquieta City. He is earning a living through agriculture, focusing on farming and hog raising. 

As a father, he believes education is a key to succeed in life. Roberto hopes to provide his family needs, especially his children's education. 

With the loan of Php 5,000, he will be able to pay for the tuition and graduation costs of his daughter. He wants his all his children to finish their studies and have stable jobs.

loans.use: to pay for the school tuition and graduation costs of his daughter

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda is 55 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Winefreda requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Winefreda has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 51 years old and married with ten children. Five of them are in school.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Alicia aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Estela works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Estela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena is a 28-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Matalena needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers, and a spear. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Matalena has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers, and a spear

loans.name: Casique Group

texts.es: Grupo Casique es un grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas que tomaron la iniciativa para solicitar los financiamientos de la institución ADIM con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia y aumentar el crecimiento de su negocio. Este grupo lo coordina la señora Blanca quien tiene la edad de 30 años, casada, el giro de su negocio es costurera y modista en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace más de dos años, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de hilos, máquina para hilos, mesas para ubicar las costuras, telas variadas, tijeras. Esta socia cuenta con excelente equipo de trabajo, la señora Amada de 51 años de edad y quien se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva en uno de los mercados de la capital, Maria Teresa una mujer de 26 años y quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Grupo Casique is a solidarity group made up of three hardworking members who took the initiative to request loans from ADIM to improve their income and their families' quality of life by expanding their businesses.

Blanca is the coordinator of the group.  She's 30 years old and married, and her business is sewing and dressmaking in her home.  She started this business more than two years ago.

She's requesting this loan to buy thread, a threading machine, dressmaker tables, a variety of fabric, and scissors.

Blanca has an excellent work team.  Amada, 51, earns a living selling new clothing in one of the markets in the capital.  María Teresa, 26, earns a living selling new and used clothing in her home.

loans.use: to buy thread, a threading machine, dressmaker tables, fabric, and scissors to expand her business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 61 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four adult-aged children. She has a shop in the market that sells fish. She has had this business for 35 years. Her husband is a farmer. She requested a loan to pay for labor for preparation of her corn production to supply corn to sell in the market. 

Monica has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Monica wants to have a rice field so she can sell rice and earn more money to saved.

loans.use: to pay for labor for preparation of corn production

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 54 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with seven adult-aged children. She has a rice field managed by her husband and has had this business for 35 years. She wants to plant different kinds of vegetables in the vacant area of her land. 

Alberta requested a loan for cultivation of her vegetable garden. This way she can increase her income. She has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Alberta hopes that her family is always in good health.

loans.use: to cultivate her vegetable garden

loans.name: Wilson Joel

texts.es: Wilson, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia  en el municipio de Mezapa, Atlántida.  El  se dedica a la venta de verduras y  legumbres como  tomate , chile, aguacates, cebolla, pataste, culantro, papas, repollo, refrescos, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, harina, arroz, etc. Este negocio lo tiene hace 2 años en un local aparte de donde vive. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la construcción de viviendas pero miró que el negocio le puede generar más  ingresos.  El  préstamo que ha solicitado es de 10,000 lempiras  y  lo invertirá en la compra de verduras de toda clase como repollo, tomate, banano, yuca, pataste, chile, cebolla,y granos básicos para surtir y vender, así mismo le ayudara, a tener mejor inventario y hacer más grande el negocio. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y mejorar la situación  familiar y personal.
texts.en:
Wilson is 42 years old and is married with two children. He lives with his family in the town of Mezapa, Atlántida. He works selling vegetables and legumes such as tomato, chilli, avocado, onion, chayote, coriander, potatoes and cabbage, as well as soft drinks, corn, beans, sugar, flour, rice, etc. He has had this business for 2 years, in a separate location from where he lives. He previously worked in housing construction, but he saw that he could earn more in his business.

He is applying for a loan of 10,000 lempiras  which he will invest in the purchase of all types of vegetables such as cabbage, tomato, banana, yucca, chayote, chilli, onion, and basic grains to stock up and sell. This will help him to have a better inventory and to expand his business. His goal is to grow his business and improve his family and personal circumstances.

loans.use: to buy all types of vegetables such as cabbage, tomato, banana, yucca, chayote, chilli, onion, and basic grains to stock up and sell.

loans.name: Zoilo

texts.en:
Zoilo is 64 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with no dependents. 

Zoilo has been engaged in his rice production activity for more than 20 years already as his main source of income. He is also receiving a monthly pension as a benefit for being privately employed before. He earns approximately PHP 2,300 each month from doing this type of work. 

Zoilo has requested a loan to be used in purchasing medicines for his maintenance. Zoilo has been a member of PMPC for almost two years.  In the future, Zoilo hopes to increase his savings deposits for future use.

loans.use: to purchase medicines

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a hardworking and persevering mother, who always knows how to provide her family the best. Daisy wants all her children to earn a degree and become successful in their chosen fields. With this loan of Php 7,000, she will be able to pay the school tuition of her daughter. She deeply wishes to live a happy and healthy life with her children having stable jobs.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition of her daughter

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina is a hardworking mother from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 39 years old and has a small business. Peregrina and her husband engage in buying and selling crabs and shrimp. She applied for a loan to purchase additional crabs and shrimp to increase her working capital. 

 Peregrina hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family. In the future, she dreams of buying a hauling truck for easy delivery of her inventory and to be able to reach other cities and municipalities.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs and shrimp for resale

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 42 years old and a widow. She is known in their area for her direct-selling business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the PMPC offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which reason she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. 

Bernadeth hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. She is very thankful when all her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and a married woman with four children who are all attending school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 46 years old and married with nine children.  With four children in school, Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

Elvie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Elvie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Elvie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two grilles and a door to ensure the security of his home

loans.name: Obaldina

texts.es:
Obaldina tiene 27 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad vive en casa de sus padres en el caserío Carrasquillo. La vida en el caserío se desarrolla tranquilamente, con lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrollan sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura(Producción y comercio de plátano) y ganadería (crianza de animales como son vacunos y ovinos). Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Obaldina es la venta de salchipollo, hamburguesa y otros. La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 3 años, en el caserío Carrasquillo. El destino del crédito será para destinarlo a activo fijo(realizar mejoras en su local de venta) pues desea realizar la compra de sillas, mesas, entre otros. Además también desea para capital de trabajo(compra de insumos para la preparación de hamburguesas). El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto es muy comercial en la zona. Obaldina piensa trabajar otorgando buen producto e incrementando sus ventas, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Obaldina, age 27, is single and has two minor children.  She lives in her parents’ house in the Carrasquillo settlement.  Life in the settlement goes on peacefully.  In regards to business and or other activity, the inhabitants work in agriculture (banana production and sales) and with livestock (raising animals like cattle and sheep).  Her community is located in the Buenos Aires district, Morropón province, and Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

Obaldina sells “salchipollo” [a local dish made with sausage, French fries, and seasonings], hamburgers, and others.  She has been doing this in the Carrasquillo settlement for over three years.

The loan will be to make improvements to her place of sales.  She wishes to buy chairs and tables, among other things.  She also wishes to have working capital (to buy supplies to make the hamburgers).

The market presents good prospects because the product is very commercial in the area.  Obaldina plans on working to produce good products and increasing her sales.  This will allow her, in the short term, to improve her income and increase her profits.  As a result she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to make improvements to her place of sales and to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stall in the market to sell fruit.

loans.name: Santos Paulina

texts.es:
Santos Paulina tiene 49 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, es madre soltera, cuenta con un hijo en su poder de 16 años el cual cursa secundaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará, ella vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. y está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Santos Paulina es la cria y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos entre otros, ubicada en su propio domicilio, cuenta con más de 20 años dedicandose a este rubro, además se dedica a realizar trabajos en chacra de arroz como siembras, desyerbos y cosecha. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en su negocio en compra de mayor cantidad de animales, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Paulina, 49, lives in her own house, made of modest materials.  She's the single mother of a dependent child, 16, who's in secondary school in a state school in the district of Pucará.  She lives in the rural part of this district and has water and electricity.  Her community--located in the district of Pucará in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru--works mainly in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Santos Paulina's job is raising and selling hens, ducks, and other small animals at home.  She has been in this line of work for more than 20 years.  She also works on rice farms planting, weeding, and harvesting.

She's going to invest the loan in her business and buy a large quantity of animals.  This will earn more income for her and she'll be able to improve her quality of life.

There's no greater competition in this business in the area, and she gets better prices.  This will allow her to improve her income in the short term, increase her profits, and, consequently, improve her quality of life and her family's.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Juliana se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 14 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo pues desea realizar la compra de pavos, gallinas, cerdos, cuyes, pichones. El préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión de animales esto con la finalidad de incrementar su productividad de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juliana is 24 years old, is in a common=law relationship and has one child under her care. She lives in her own house in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru. Her community works mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Juliana has been working raising and selling farm animals for 14 years. Her business is at the back of her house. She is requesting the loan to have working capital to be able to buy turkeys, chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and chicks. The loan will help her have a greater investment in animals with the goal of increasing her productivity and supply demand from her clients. This will allow her in the short term to increase her income and profits and in the end improve the quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to have working capital as she wants to buy turkeys, chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay registration fees for his administration studies.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana Isabel tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Ana Isabel se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza(joyas, talcos, perfumes, entre otros), con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, el miso que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para compra de mercadería(talcos, perfumes,etc.), dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad de productos, con gran influencia en el negocio; ella piensa incrementar su negocio para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel is 38 years old, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. Her community works mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Ana Isabel works selling cosmetics and beauty products (jewellery, talcum, perfume amongst others). She has more than 5 years experience in the business which is located in her house. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (talc, perfumes, etc.). This investment will help her to have a greater variety of products and will make a big difference to her business. She is thinking of expanding her business to be able to provide for the various needs and tastes of her customers in the area. In the short term this will allow her to increase her income and profits and in the end improve the quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (talc, perfume. etc.).

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is thankful that she was previously granted a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gina wants to grow her business into a restaurant. She also dreams of buying a house for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Geraldine Lisseth

texts.es:
Geraldine es una joven estudiante de SENATI, vive junto a su madre y su hermano menor. Sus padres son separados, pero su madre actualmente tiene otro compromiso. Su padrastro trabaja de manera informal como Chofer, mientras que su madre es ama de casa. 
Actualmente se encuentra cursando el Tercer Ciclo de la carrera de Administración Industrial;  debido al horario y a los cursos que está llevando se le dificulta trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo, por lo que le es muy importante contar con el apoyo de KIVA para poder continuar con sus estudios, ya que por la actual situación económica que está pasando su familia, le es muy complicado seguir costeando sus estudios.
Ella es una joven muy emprendedora, feliz con la carrera que está estudiando debido a que actualmente es una de las carreras con más demanda y siente que la beneficiará económicamente y le permitirá apoyar a su familia, quienes se sentirán orgullosos de que ella pudo lograr sus objetivos a pesar de los obstáculos presentados durante todo el camino.
Ella agradece el apoyo que KIVA brinda a través de los Créditos Educativos otorgados por IPFE, ya que brinda el apoyo para continuar estudiando y eso es esencial para poder lograr algo en la vida, mejorar, crecer profesionalmente y como personas, para servir y ser útil a la sociedad, apoyando a sus familias, si realmente quieren lograr algo pues deben darse cuenta de que no existe barreras para hacerlo, con perseverancia y esfuerzo todo se logra.
texts.en:
Geraldine is a young student at SENATI. She lives with her mother and her younger brother. Her parents are separated but her mother is in another relationship now. Her step father works informally as a driver and her mother is a housewife. 

Right now she is in the third year of Industrial Management. Because of the schedule and the courses she is taking it is difficult to work and go to school at the same time, so it is very important to her to have the support of KIVA so she can continue with her education. Because of the financial situation her family is going through is is very complicated for them to keep paying for her education.

She is a very enterprising young woman. She is happy with her major because right now it is one of the degrees that are most in demand and she feels that it will benefit her financially and and allow her to support her family. They will be proud that she was able to reach her goals despite the obstacles she has faced the whole way. 

She is grateful for the support KIVA has given through the education loans granted through IPFE. It gives help to continue education and that is essential  to be able to achieve something in life and improve and grow professionally and personally to serve and be be useful to society and help their families. If they really want to achieve something they have to realize there are no obstacles to doing it. With perseverance and hard work everything can be achieved.

loans.use: to keep studying Industrial Management in SENATI, become an excellent professional and have her own business.

loans.name: Geordina

texts.es: Geordina: Es originaria de Waspam, casada con 2 hijos, mayores de edad. Cuenta con una experiencia de 19 años de ser enfermera, su esposo es ebanista. Desde hace 22 años habita en una vivienda de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda solicita su primer financiamiento para cambiar la madera del piso de su vivienda y acondicionar 3 cuartos para su alquiler. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
Geordina is from Waspam.  She's married and has two adult children.  She has 19 years of experience as a nurse.  Her husband's a carpenter.

Geordina has lived for 22 years in a wood house on stilts.  She wants to make home improvements, so she's requesting her first loan to replace the wood floor and renovate three bedrooms to rent.

Her dream is to have a home made of concrete.

loans.use: to replace the wood floor of her home and to renovate three bedrooms to rent

loans.name: Rosa Yolani

texts.es: ROSA YOLANI: Es una señora amable y alegre, originaria de Waspam, casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 9 años cursa su primaria y una pequeña de 2 meses. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 años estableció su pequeña pulpería. Solicita su primer financiamiento para mejorar su nivel de ingresos y comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, sopas instantáneas, leche en polvo, productos enlatados, entre otros. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: ROSA YOLANI: She is a kind and cheerful woman from Waspam. She is married and has 2 children. The oldest is 9 years old and in primary school and she has a 2 month old daughter. In order to have her own source of income, she opened her own convenience store 3 years ago. She is asking for her first loan to improve her income and buy basic grains, yogurt, instant soup, powdered milk, canned goods, and more. Her dream is to have a prosperous business and to improve her home.

loans.use: to improve her income level and buy basic grains, instant soups, powdered milk, canned goods, and more.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente: Es originario de Waspam, casado, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda de tambo de madera, solicita su segundo financiamiento para construir un anexo, el cual será utilizado como cuarto para uno de sus hijos. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
Vicente is from Waspam.  His is married and has three minor children who attend elementary school.

In order to improve his wooden house on stilts, he is requesting his second loan so that he can build an addition to the house.  It will be used as a room for one of his children.  His dream is to have a house made of concrete.

loans.use: to build an addition to his house.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora, por iniciativa propia empezó su propio negocio de venta de ropa en su ciudad natal, Santa. También ha comenzado con el negocio de venta de cosméticos, más adelante espera ampliar su negocio y comprarse un local para una mejor estabilidad. Ella cree que le está yendo bien porque es muy amable con los clientes y responsable.
Carmen quiere crecer más como empresaria por ello piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar ropa de temporada y así surtir su negocio, ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, más adelante espera crecer como empresaria y así sacar adelante a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Carmen is an enterprising woman and a fighter. On her own initiative she opened her own business of selling clothing in her native city of Santa. She also started selling cosmetics. Later on she wants to expand her business and buy a stand to make her business more stable. She feels that things are going well as she is very friendly and responsible with her clients. Carmen wants to grow more as a businessperson so she is thinking of using the loan to buy seasonal clothing and stock her business. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity. Later she hopes to grow as a businessperson and get all her loved ones ahead.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Oli

texts.en:
Oli is a 29-year-old married woman with 1 child. 

She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Oli needs a loan to buy flippers, goggles, fishing gear, and a small fishing canoe. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Oli has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy flippers, goggles, fishing gear, and a small fishing canoe

loans.name: Leizl

texts.en:
Leizl is 37 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Leizl works very hard to provide for them.

Leizl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leizl has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, diapers, spices and other groceries.

In the future Leizl would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 53, is the widowed mother of ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Maria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Maria requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Maria has been in this business for four years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children. Two of her children are in school, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Thelma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Thelma has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Thelma would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Romurica

texts.en:
Romurica previously accessed a 24,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her PisoNet business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan for her to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her PisoNet units. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Romurica wants to expand her business and she hopes to buy a house someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her PisoNet units.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is grateful for the PHP 50,000 loan that was granted to her. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her buy-and-sell business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard, to provide for their everyday needs.

Now, she would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan. It will be used to buy additional merchandise, such as flat irons, washing machines, DVD players, rice cookers, standing fans, and other appliances needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emelita hopes that her business will continue to be successful, and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock, i.e., merchandise like flat irons, washing machines, DVD players, rice cookers, and standing fans

loans.name: Elgie

texts.en:
Elgie is married, and she works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal-retailing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Elgie is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell to her customers. Elgie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rashila Talle

texts.en:
Rashila Talle is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rashila Talle joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Gabrel, Nura and Loise. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rashila Talle would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rashila Talle can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Rashila Talle  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like school fees and food, and store her harvest to sell it later at higher prices.

loans.name: Conny Jahaira

texts.es: CONNY JAHAIRA: Es una señora alegre y amable, originaria de Waspam, tiene 33 años de edad, casada con 3 hijas, en edad escolar. Cuenta con una experiencia de 12 años de ser docente. Su esposo es agricultor. Desde hace 11 años alquilaba, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 800 (Ochocientos Cordobas Netos), gracias a los financiamientos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA, le permitieron construir su vivienda de tambo de madera. Solicita financiamiento, para realizar las divisiones internas de la vivienda, comprar 300 pies tablar de madera, ya que actualmente la vivienda es de un solo espacio. Su sueño es que cada una de sus hijas tengan su propio cuarto, construir un corredor en su vivienda, para evitar que se moje en periodo de invierno.
texts.en:
CONNY JAHAIRA is a happy and friendly woman, native of Waspam. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. She has 12 years experience as a teacher. Her husband is a farmer. For the past 11 years she has rented, paying 800 NIO monthly.

Thanks to the loans provided by Pana Pana she has been able to build her own wooden house on stilts. She is requesting a loan to build the divisions inside her house. She will buy 300 ft of boards as right now the house is just one large space. Her dream is for each of her daughters has her own room and to build a veranda on her house so that they don't get wet during the rainy season.

loans.use: to divide the interior of her wooden house built on stilts.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 48 years old and married, and she has five children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro and bananas. She can sell these in her community, or at the market. She has been doing this for 12 years

Elena needs a loan to buy sprayers, chemicals, fertilizers, crops, new boots, and a new wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2002. Elena will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, chemicals, fertilizers, crops, new boots, and a new wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional merchandise needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will lend her again an amount of 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). This new loan will go to additional stock of ready-to-wear products like jackets, polo, shirts and other items of the same kind to expand her product inventory. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from expanding her business, Maria wants also to earn additional income by finding a right-fit job for her. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like jackets, shirts and other products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Easter

texts.en:
Easter is a 44-year-old single woman with five children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Easter needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Easter has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove

loans.name: Daniela Maria

texts.es: DANIELA MARIA: Es una señora amable, originaria de Rosita, casada con 4 hijos: 3 en edad escolar y una pequeña de 8 meses. Su esposo es comerciante. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace 10 meses, estableció su negocio de comideria y venta de refrescos y repostería, en un punto estratégico del municipio de Rosita. Solicita financiamiento para mejorar la infraestructura de su local y comprar insumos para elaborar repostería: harina, levadura, aceite, azúcar, huevos y frutas para la preparación de refrescos. Su sueño es tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Daniela Maria is a friendly woman who is from Rosita. She is married and has 4 children; three of her children are school-aged and one is an eight month old baby. Her husband is a merchant. Ten months ago, in order to earn her own source of income, she started a business where she sells beverages and baked goods. It is located in a strategic location in Rosita.

She requests a loan to improve her store's infrastructure and purchase supplies like flour, yeast, oil, sugar, eggs, and fruit to make baked goods and beverages. Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to improve her store's infrastructure and purchase supplies like flour, yeast, oil, sugar, eggs, and fruit to make baked goods and beverages.

loans.name: Jelson Bladimir

texts.es: JELSON BLADIMIR: Es un joven de 24 años, originario de Rosita, casado. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la ganadería. Su esposa es ama de casa. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar 5 novillos, engordarlos y comercializarlos. Cuenta con el apoyo de su tío, que le presta su finca, ubicada en la comunidad que se llama Las Brechas, ubicada a 2 horas del municipio de Rosita, para criar al ganado y que coman pasto. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Jelson Bladimir is a young, 24-year-old man who is from Rosita. He is married. Five years ago, he began working as a cattle farmer. His wife works in the home. 

He is requesting his first loan, which he will use to purchase 5 heifers, fatten them, and sell them. He counts on his uncle's support. His uncle lent him his farm, which is located in a community called Las Brechas, located about 2 hours from Rosita. There, he raises his cattle and puts them out to pasture. His dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 heifers, fatten them, and sell them.

loans.name: Viona

texts.en:
Viona is a 34-year-old married woman with 7 children. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 6 years of experience with this business. 

Viona needs a loan to buy yeast, a large frying pan, a new oven, bags of flour, cooking oil, and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses. 

Viona has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy yeast, a large frying pan, a new oven, bags of flour, cooking oil, and plastic bags

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Wassa est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Souroukoukin de la Commune de Koury qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et ont au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, condiments, habillements, céréales, pièce de pagnes et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe.
Awa, arrêtée au milieu, est une vendeuse de pièces de pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de pièces de pagnes en quantité et en qualité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure à Koury. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Wassa comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175 000CFA chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Awa compte réaliser  195 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Wassa is the name of a group of women from the district Souroukoukin of the township of Koury who know each other well and who live in big traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They have an average age of 29 and at least two children. 

This group of women sell various items such as condiments, clothing, cereals, lengths of colorful African print cloth, and so on. To expand their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their third group loan. 

Awa, standing in the middle, sells lengths of African print cloth. She intends to use her loan to buy lengths of pagne (print cloth) in large quantity and of high quality as she retails her inventory, little by little, to a diverse clientele. She buys her wares in Koury. 

Whereas the other members of Wassa group expect to make an average profit of 175,000 F CFA each during this loan cycle, Madame Awa expects to make 195,000 F CFA. Besides reimbursing their loans, the women use a part of the income for personal expenses and grow their working capital. They hope to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their inventory is always ample.

loans.use: to buy lengths of colorful African print cloth

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en:
Tâm works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Tâm is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tâm faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to build a biogas system.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Năm

texts.en:
Năm operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Năm is 41 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Năm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Năm has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Năm faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Năm hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchace bricks, cement and sand to build a toilet

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer multifacética, que no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad de negocios. Antes ella alquilaba bicicletas para los turistas, trabajo con el cual fue creciendo e invirtió con el préstamo anterior. Compró y dio mantenimiento a este transporte. A pesar que ahora solo está enfocada en la venta de refrescos naturales, sabe que sin ese crédito no hubiese obtenido el dinero para seguir prosperando en su otro negocio. De manera que agradece a todos los que le extendieron las manos para salir adelante.
Actualmente Juana tiene muchas metas por delante, las cuales sabe que no las podrá cumplir más que con el arduo trabajo que poco a poco ha ido cultivando. Ahora es hasta proveedora de trabajos a otras mujeres con deseo de superación. Por esta razón, esta comerciante de refrescos solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar azúcar, frutas, bolsas de plástico y hielo para sus refrescos. Esto le permitirá encaminarse más a cumplir con su sueño de establecer un comedor y construir su nueva casa sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Juana is a multifaceted woman that doesn't waste any business opportunity.  Before, she used to rent bicycles to tourists, work which allowed her to keep growing and investing in her last loan.  She bought and maintained the bicycles.  Although now she is only focused on the sale of natural fruit juices, she knows that without the last loan she never would have had the money to keep growing in her other business.  This is why she is grateful to all those who offered a helping hand to help her succeed. 

Currently, Juana has several future goals, which she knows she won't be able to achieve without hard work, which she has learned to cultivate little by little.  Now she has become an employment provider for other women who have a desire to excel. For this reason, this juice saleswoman is requesting a new loan; to buy sugar, fruit, plastic bags and ice for her juices.  This will put her in the right path to achieving her goals of opening a small restaurant and building a new house, without any problems.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fuit, plastic pags and ice

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 43 years old and has five children. Elsie is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Elsie is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsie has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 37 years old and has three children. Elvira is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Elvira is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elvira has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Francisco Alberto

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Francisco refleja que se siente más que completo con la carrera universitaria que eligió. Pancho, como también es conocido por sus amistades, tiene tan solo 20 años de edad y siente que va por buen camino, ya que siempre ha sido un sueño obtener la licenciatura donde pueda en un futuro dirigir negocios y crear grandes empresas. Actualmente cursa el segundo año de la carrera Administración de empresas. 
Francisco cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su madre, quien tiene una pequeña pulpería, y de su hermana, quien trabaja en una empresa. Él no desea llegar a tener ningún tipo de obstáculo para poder salir adelante, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y unos libros que le exigen en la universidad. Estos materiales le permitirán mejorar su desempeño en clases. Entre sus planes está obtener su licenciatura de Administración de empresas para poder emplear sus conocimientos en el área laboral.
texts.en:
Francisco's smile reflects his complete satisfaction with the university major that he chose. Pancho, as he is also known by his friends, is only 20 years old and feels that he is on track, since he has always dreamed of  getting a degree that would allow him to one day conduct business and create large companies. He is currently in his second year of a business administration degree.
Francisco has the unconditional support of his mother, who has a small grocery store, and of his sister, who works at a company. He doesn’t want to end up with any hurdles to getting ahead, so he is requesting a loan to buy a computer and some books that his university requires. These materials will allow him to improve his performance in class. One of his plans is to get his degree in business administration to apply his knowledge in the workplace.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some books.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth: Es una señora originaria de Rosita, tiene 40 años de edad, casada con 8 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad e independientes y 4 adolescentes que cursan su primaria y secundaria. Su esposo es jubilado. Desde hace 11 años habita en vivienda de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de construir su vivienda de concreto, solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: bloques, cemento, hierro, arena, láminas de zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a woman who is originally from Rosita. She is 40 years old, is married, and has 8 children, 4 of whom are adults and 4 of whom are in primary or secondary school. Her husband is retired. 

For the past 11 years, she has lived in a wooden home. She is requesting her second loan to purchase construction materials like cinder blocks, cement, iron, sand, zinc laminate, and nails, and to pay laborers to build a concrete home. Her dream is to finish construction on her home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like cinder blocks, cement, iron, sand, zinc laminate, and nails, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is 38 years old and single. She has four children. She owns and operates a small flea market, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for five years.

Lesina needs a loan to buy elei printed fabrics, Samoan carved earrings, bangles, printed caps, and dresses. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy goods including elei printed fabrics, Samoan carved earrings, and bangles

loans.name: Hường

texts.en:
Hường works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for 7 years.

Hường is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hường has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hường hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement and sand to build a toilet.

loans.name: Tausili

texts.en:
Tausili is 56 years old and divorced. She has eight children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro and bananas. She can sell these in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years.

Tausili needs a loan to buy new boots, chemicals, crops, fertilizer, a new spade, a machete and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Tausili will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new boots, chemicals, crops, fertilizer, a new spade, a machete and a crowbar

loans.name: Mafoe

texts.en:
Mafoe is 30 years old and married with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Mafoe needs a loan to buy a machete, chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a new spade and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Mafoe will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a machete, chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a new spade and crops

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti is 39 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for nine years. 

Koreti needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers, a machete, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, boots, gloves, overalls and a pitchfork. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Koreti will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers, a machete, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, boots, gloves, overalls and a pitchfork

loans.name: Fuifui

texts.en:
Fuifui is 40 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Fuifui needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, crops, boots and a new machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Fuifui will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, crops, boots and a new machete

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
For the last three years Peris has been selling assorted clothes and earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

Peris  is 34 years old. She is married to Peter and blessed with one child.

She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of both new and second hand clothes

 Peris will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to add more stocks of both new and second hand clothes.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. Leah is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Leah requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods like curtains, slippers, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell.

Leah has been in this business for 8 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods like curtains, slippers, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is married and she works hard to support her family. 

Cirila has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Cirila has been in this business for 23 years now.

Cirila requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cirila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Crismelen

texts.en:
Crismelen is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Crismelen is 28 years old and has one child who is in school.

Crismelen has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Crismelen requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Crismelen has been in this business for seven years. Crismelen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janet is 40 years old, and one child is currently in school.

Janet has a general store business in the Philippines. Janet requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Janet has been in this business for six years. Janet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Evelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, coffee, juice, noodles, beers, etc. to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Evelyn has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, coffee, juice, noodles, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty products in Managua like cosmetics, hair dye, cream, shampoo, conditioner, and hair treatments.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan entrenched his business. He was able to purchase additional groceries and other products needed to increase his inventory. The loan also helped him provide for his daily needs.

He is very positive that he could improve more his business if you will lend him an amount of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). This new loan will go to additional groceries and items needed in his variety store and repacking business. His customers will be likely to buy more items if he has more of his products displayed in his store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result for his business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family.

Aside from growing his business, Lolito wants to establish his own family that is loving and caring. He also hopes to open another outlet sooner. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries and other products to add to his inventory.

loans.name: Noselyn

texts.en:
This is Noselyn. She previously accessed a 60,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings have been a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
