Noselyn dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario. She is thankful for the loan previously granted to her. She has used the loan to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear products for women which she resells. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosario still desires that her children will complete their schooling. She aims to have her boutique shop to house all her products. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear products mostly ladies' wear.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
This is Saturnino. He previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, mineral water and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Saturnino hopes that his business will continue to flourish and dreams that his child will finish college. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aida is 49 years old and has four children who are in school.

Aida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Aida has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Junabelle

texts.en:
Junabelle works hard to support her family. Junabelle is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Junabelle requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional tools and equipment for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Junabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is 53 years old and married with seven children. Priscila works very hard to provide for them.

Priscila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Priscila has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Priscila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
Amancia works hard to support her family. Amancia is widowed and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Amancia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Amancia has been in this business for 41 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Amancia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta works hard to support her family. Antonieta is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now. Antonieta requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

In the future, Antonieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Candelaria is 26 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Candelaria has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Candelaria requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Candelaria has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Candelaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 37 years old and has seven children. Cecilia is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Cecilia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cecilia has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 28 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables, corn and bananas in the Philippines. Divina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy seedlings, seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Divina has been farming vegetables, corn and bananas for 5 years and also earns additional income from abaca weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a married woman charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children. Two of her children attend school. 

She sells clothes as the main source of her income and earns additional income from farming. 

Her desire is to grow and expand her business and also to educate her children.
 
Harriet will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kharim

texts.en:
Kharim is a hardworking married man with five children, two of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda. 

He owns a butchery, mainly selling beef and goat meat. He earns an additional income from agriculture. He hopes to expand and grow his business as well as educate his children. 

He will use the loan to buy more cows for slaughtering.

loans.use: to buy more cows for slaughtering.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso: Es un señor amable y luchador, originario de Rosita, tiene 32 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos, en edad escolar. Su esposa es ama de casa. Él trabaja como vigilante. Desde hace 11 años habita en una vivienda de tambo de madera. Solicita financiamiento para suplir algunos gastos del hogar como alimentación y terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las mejores comodidades.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a friendly and determined man from Rosita. He is 32 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. His wife works in the home. He works as a security guard.

For the past 11 years, he has lived in a wooden home. He is requesting a loan to cover some household expenses, like food, and finish construction on his home. His dream is to provide his family with a comfortable home.

loans.use: to pay some household expenses, like food, and finish construction on his wooden home.

loans.name: Aida Sofia

texts.es:
Cada vez que Aida sostiene la pluma sobre una hoja de cuaderno, las ideas fluyen como agua en el rio. Esta joven de 22 años de edad, es caracterizada por su creatividad y preocupación por la política y cultura general de Nicaragua, razón suficiente para elegir Comunicación Social como carrera universitaria. Ella siente que ha podido realizarse profesional, ya que a su cuarto año de la carrera ha salido a la calle a conseguir sus trabajos de campo.
Aida cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, quienes trabajan en la Alcaldía, además que el papá envía una cuota mensual para ella y sostiene una beca que ha ganado por ser excelente alumna. En estos momentos ella solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y cámara fotográfica para poder llevar a cabo de forma más independiente sus trabajos de campo. Entre sus planes está convertirse en una escritora profesional y hacer una maestría en cuanto termine su licenciatura.
texts.en:
Every time Aida holds her pen over a page of her notebook, the ideas flow like water in the river. This young woman of 22 is characterized by her creativity and her concern for Nicaragua's politics and general culture, reason enough to choose Social Communication as her major at university. She feels she has been able to become a professional. Now in her fourth year, she has gone out into the streets to get work in the field.

Aida has the support of her parents, who work in city government, and her father sends her a monthly allowance. She also holds a scholarship she has earned for being an excellent student. Right now she is requesting a loan to buy a computer and a camera in order to be able to conduct her field work in the most independent way possible. She plans to become a professional writer and go for a master's degree when she finishes her bachelor's.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a camera.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria esta divorciada y se quedo a cargo de 3 hijos Gloria vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Gloria trabaja  como secretaria y quiere un prestamo para hacerse un tratamiento medico urgente Gloria es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Gloria is divorced and supports her three children. She lives in La Paz in her own home, which is made of brick and cement. She works as a secretary.

She needs a loan to pay for an urgent medical treatment. Gloria's job is the only source of income for her household, so she needs help.

loans.use: to pay for a medical treatment.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: Zulma es una mujer soltera que vive en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino que le pertenece a sus abuelos Zulma es comunicadora social pero no pudo obtener trabajo en el area por lo que esta trabajando en el aeropuerto y tiene que soportar pesadas cargas y tambien esta expuesta a robo de paquetes Zulma quiere un credito para pagar un curso de comercio exterior y de esa manera poder encontrar mejores opciones de trabajo Zulma es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y necesita su ayuda porque como pueden ver en la foto, ella esta esperando un hijo
texts.en:
Zulma is a single woman who lives in La Paz in a nice home that belongs to her grandparents. Zulma is a social communicator but has not been able to find a job in that area, so she is working at an airport. There, she has to lift heavy items and is also exposed to theft. 

Zulma would like a loan to pay for a course in foreign commerce so that she can find a better job. Zulma's job is the only source of income in her household but she is in good health and, as you can see in the photograph, she is expecting a baby.

loans.use: to pay for a course in foreign commerce.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is 37 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Gemma has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a 17000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Gemma has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena works hard to support her family and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Lucena requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from soft drinks retailing. 

Rosa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers for her buy and sell used clothing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. Maricel is married and has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Maricel requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maricel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen, 37, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carmen has a selling medicines and multi-vitamins business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Carmen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of medicines and multi-vitamins to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of medicines and multi-vitamins to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 44 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Emma has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Emma has been in this business for 4 years. Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Gregoria requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Gregoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is 56 years old and married with four children.

Apolinaria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Apolinaria has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Apolinaria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 39 years old and has four children.She is married and four of her children are in school.

Edwina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Edwina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edwina has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Edwina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 35 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, cereals, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, beers, etc. to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, cereals, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, beers, etc. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, noodles, cereals, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 48, is a married woman, with ten children. Four of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a business, selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda tiene 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su cónyugue no cuenta con ningún hijo en su poder. Leonilda es natural de la zona. Ella vive en la parte rural del distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Ubicada en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Leonilda es a la venta de productos de primera necesidad contando con clientela propia de la zona, asi como también se dedica a la cria de animales menores. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en compra de mercaderia para surtir más su negocio con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Leonilda, 52, lives with her husband in her own house, made of modest materials.  She has no children in her care.  Leonilda's from the area.  She lives in the rural part of the district and has water and electricity.  Her community is located in the Colasay district of the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.  The people work mainly in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Leonilda's job is selling staple products to her own customers in the area.  She also raises small animals.

She's going to use the loan to buy merchandise to better stock her store.  This will generate more income for her and she'll be able to improve her quality of life.  There's no greater competition in this business in the area, and she gets the best prices.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es: Valerio esta casado y tiene dos hijos Valerio vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad pero la vivienda no esta amurallada y tiene que reemplazarse la puerta principal Valerio tiene dos ocupaciones: es albañil y chofer, entre las condiciones duras de su trabajo se encuentra el pesado traslado de materiales como ladrillos y cemento Valerio quiere un credito para poder amurallar su casa con el fin de tener mas seguridad Valerio es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Valerio is married with two children.  Valerio lives in La Paz, in a house made of brick and concrete, which he owns himself.  However, his home is not walled, and the front door needs to be replaced. 

Valerio has two occupations—he is a bricklayer and a taxi driver.  His difficult  working conditions include carrying heavy loads of materials such as brick and concrete.

Valerio wants a loan so that he can put a wall around his house in order to have more security.  Valerio is the only source of income for his home, but he enjoys good health, and he needs a little help.

loans.use: to put a wall around his house in order to have more security.

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: NOGAYE est une femme qui habite dans le même quartier ou se situe le guichet. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et n’a pas de parent bénéficiaires dans  l’institution. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des fruits et légumes. Elle a comme charge personnelles ses soins médicaux, sinon les autres dépenses quotidiennes sont gérer par son mari. Elle commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 22h. Elle souhaite à l’avenir, une cantine au niveau de la grande ville. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. De ce fait elle pourra augmenter ses revenus, payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Nogaye is a woman who lives in the same neighborhood where the branch office is located. She is married and the mother of a family and has no relatives benefiting from the Institution. She has been selling fruit and vegetables. She has more than 10 years' experience and is asking for this loan to buy and sell fruit and vegetables. She needs to cover her own medical expenses, but their daily expenses are managed by her husband. 

Nogaye begins her day at 10 AM and ends it at 10 PM. She wishes in future to have a shop located in the big city. Thus she would be able to grow her stock of goods and diversify her inventory. In that way, she will be able to grow her income, pay school fees for her children, and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct selling Dakki (a direct-sales brand) products business in the Philippines.

Joan requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of Dakki products to sell to her customers.

Joan has been in this business for 3 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of Dakki products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with four children.  

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a 22000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Jocelyn has been raising livestock for 10 years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Judita

texts.en:
Judita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Judita has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food production business, like meat, rice, vegetables, and spices. She has been in this business for five years, now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her foods, like meat, vegetables, and spices

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 55 years old and married, with four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Julieta has been raising pigs for five years, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

Julieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 45 years old and married, with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

Leah has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Leah aspires to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 57 years old and married with six children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, she has been a vegetable farmer in the Philippines. Luzviminda has borrowed eight previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Luzviminda is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Melanie

texts.en:
Ma. Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has operated this business for the past year and earns additional income from fattening pigs. Ma. Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. 

Ma. Melanie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 24 years old, married, and has one child, age one year. 

He rides a motorcycle, transporting people from one place to another, and he supplements that by income from dealing in produce, mainly buying and selling beans and maize, among other things. 

He desires to expand his business and build a permanent house, though his business growth is affected by the bad roads. 

He will use the loan money to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and wood to build a fishing boat.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a married mother of three children, ages 3 to 12 years. She describes herself as obedient. She operates a retail business where she sells medicine and cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to expand her business. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine and cosmetics. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business and open more branches elsewhere and educate her children. This is her ninth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine and cosmetics

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a married mother of three children, ages 8  to 25 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to expand her business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a candle-making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy additional materials for making candles, like wax, cord, etcetera. Lilia has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income by farming vegetables. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for making candles, like wax, cord, etcetera.

loans.name: Ma. Renefe

texts.en:
Ma. Renefe is 39 years old and is married with five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, she has been fattening pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Renefe has borrowed one previous loan from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Ma. Renefe is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now and works hard to support her family. Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan. 

Marie is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear such as blouses, t-shirts, shorts, and other items to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, t-shirts, shorts, and other items to sell

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is 54 years old and married with four children.  

Mauricia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mauricia requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and other supplies for her business.

Mauricia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Mauricia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Melquiadesa

texts.en:
Melquiadesa works hard to support her family. Melquiadesa is married and has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Melquiadesa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Melquiadesa has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Melquiadesa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 41-year-old married mother of four children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marites has a general store business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marites has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 40 years old and married.  

Mildred is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mildred has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Mildred would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamin for her pigs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is single and has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines.

Nancy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell to her customers.

Nancy has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Narcisa is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of ice cream to sell to her customers.

Narcisa has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ice cream to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 55 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid back 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending. Nelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 38-year-old lady who is married with seven children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Jane operates a retail shop of general merchandise. She has been in that business for three years.  

She begun the business in order to look after her family. She has a dream of educating her children despite being faced with challenges of limited capital and price fluctuations.

Jane wants money to buy soap, sugar, maize flour, and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, maize flour, and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es: ALCIRA es una joven de 18 años, hija mayor de cuatro hermanos  en su familia que por motivos económicos dejo sus sueños de realizar estudios  superiores ya que recientemente salió de la secundaria y tuvo que trabajar junto a uno de sus familiares como ayudante en un taller de costura. Alcira quiere un credito para comprar una maquina de cocer semiindustrial, de esa manera podra abrir su propio taller o empezar sus propios trabajos y ganar mas dinero Alcira no recibe dinero de sus padres, goza de buena salud por lo que pueden confiar en ella
texts.en:
Alcira is a young, 18-year-old woman. She is the oldest of four daughters in her family who, for financial reasons, had to abandon her dreams of higher education. She recently left secondary school and had to work with one of her family members in a sewing workshop.

Alcira would like a loan to purchase a semi-industrial sewing machine so that she can open her own workshop or start her own business to earn more money. Alcira does not receive money from her parents. She is in good health, so they have confidence in her.

loans.use: to purchase a semi-industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El socio sigue dedicándose a la venta de comestibles, el socio vende lo que son arroz,azúcar,leche entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan , él socio también continua trabajando  en construcción civil, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, leche entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to sell groceries. He sells rice, sugar, milk and other items to all the customers who seek him out. He also continues to work in construction, with this being the work that supports his family.

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy sugar, milk and other items. He feels grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk and other items.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married mother of five children, ages 10 to 25 years. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to expand her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a widowed woman who has five children with ages ranging from three to 20. She describes herself to be strong, loving. Joan operates a business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are of all types. Joan’s biggest business challenge is changes in season. 

Joan is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothing. This will be her fourth loan with SMEP. She successfully repaid her previous loans. Joan’s business goal is to open another shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a Kiva borrower. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells scrap metal. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are factories dealing with metal. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of scrap metal. He hopes that in the future, he will live a comfortable life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of scrap metal.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. 

Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the inflation of prices. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy materials to put up a business premises. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy materials to put up a business premises.

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Philister is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be persistent. She operates a retail business where she grows fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of her products. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. 

Her business goal is to have a big grocery within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will give her children the best education. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is a married father of three children. He describes himself as a person with potential. He operates a retail business where he sells speakers, keyboards, paper bags, watches and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of keyboards, watches, speakers and other items. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more stock of keyboards, watches, speakers and other items

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. For the past four years, Marita has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, cereals, detergent, noodles, and other products. 

Marita is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries such as soft-drinks, cereals, milk, juice, sugar, detergent, noodles to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soft-drinks, cereals, milk, juice, sugar, detergent, and noodles

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, noodles, spices, and vegetables for her food-vending business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, noodles, spices, and vegetables for her food-vending business

loans.name: Zenda

texts.en:
Zenda is a 44-year-old married mother of five children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Zenda has a flower-vending business in the Philippines. Zenda requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more flowers to sell to her customers.

Zenda has been in this business for 15 years. Zenda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more flowers to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mourice's Group

texts.en:
Mourice, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years and is now proud to represent his group of seven farmers in Butere District. He is 50 years old, married, and has six children.

Mourice likes to think of himself as a very hard-working individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and he decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Mourice plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Mourice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 3.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.en:
Teodocia is 46 years old and married with three children. For the past 14 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income vending food. Teodocia works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF.

Teodocia is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, canned goods, fabric conditioners, and other products to sell. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, canned goods, and fabric conditioners

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Anastacia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Anastacia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Anastacia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Paciana

texts.en:
Paciana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a native basket weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice and beans in order to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Consolata's Group

texts.en:
Consolata's Group consists of nine farmers in the Butere District and is led by Consolata, who is pictured above. She is 35 years old, married and has four children. Consolata has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Consolata isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money. This year, Consolata will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Consolata's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Danixa

texts.es:
La socia Danixa se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, la socia vende cemento, arena y clavos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, clavos y arena.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Danixa continues devoting herself to her construction material sales business.  She sells cement, sand, and nails, working from 8:00 A.M. until 8:00 P.M.

She has been in this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her construction material sales business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase cement, nails, and sand.

She is happy about the loan, and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase cement, nails, and sand.

loans.name: 73-Luciernagas Group

texts.es:
Juanita es una mujer de 54 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 12 años y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas que lo realizan descendientes de las etnias ‘Ayoreas’ del lugar y descendiente de mineros relocalizados de occidente, ahora como segunda generación de los originales se dedican al comercio y la manufactura, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura aproximada de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Juanita es de tez morena, cabello negro/gris, de estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla espeñol (la segunda de la izquierda, usa vestido celeste)su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Los deseos de superación para mejorar su negocio la llevaron a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té, taller de costura, elaboración de empanadas, venta de productos cosméticos y elaboración de colchones,  para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte ”taitetú” frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), etc. La comida que realiza es deliciosa por lo que tiene clientes constantes y habituales. Su sueño es tener un restaurante con variedad de comidas y abrir una pulpería. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de una cocina grande y utensilios de cocina como; cucharones, cuchillos, ollas, etc. Esta es la sexta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juanita solicita un préstamo para la compra de cocina y utensilios para poder cocinar mayor variedad de comidas.
texts.en:
Juanita is a 54 year old woman, she lives with her partner, she has 1 son of 12 years old and her business is the sale of traditional dishes.  She is a good mother, independent, constant, active, responsible and hard-working.  She works her business in the "3000 Plan" zone, an area characterized for its business and trade, activities which are done by descendants of the ethnic group Ayoreo and the descendants of miners relocated from the west.  Now, as the second generation in the area, they mainly work in commerce and manufacturing.  The climate is warm, tropical and humid with an average yearly temperature of about 30 degrees Celsius.  Juanita is of dark complexion, black and grey hair, average height, her mother tongue is Guarani and she also speaks Spanish (she is the second from the left in a sky blue dress)

She lives with her partner who works in transport and her son, who studies.  They live in their own house which has drinking water and electricity.  Her desires of succeeding in improving her business has brought her to bring together a bank of people with businesses such as: cellphone sales, sale of chickens, sale of flowers, tea services, sewing services, preparing empanada, cosmetic products sales and mattress making, to ask for a loan to grow their businesses.  

Her business is the sale of traditional dishes like; majadito jerky (beef jerky, rice, fried egg and fried plantain), locro carretero of Santa Cruz (a thick stew made of beef jerky, little pieces of beef, yucca and egg), soaked soup (soup of bones), Taitetu pork cracklings (fried pigs from Mt. Taitetu), stuffed neck (neck of Creole chicken filled with either potatoes or a type of vegetable stuffing), etc.  The food that she prepares is delicious which is why she has a regular and constant client base.  Her dream is to have a restaurant with a wide variety of food and open a corner store.

Her dream is to grow her business by buying a big oven and cooking utensils like: big spoons, knives, pots, etc. This is the 6th sequence of loans with this institution in 3 years which is working in this same activity.  It is for this reason that Juanita is requesting a loan; for the purchase of an oven and utensils to be able to cook a wider variety of dishes.

loans.use: to buy a stove and utensils to be able to cook a wider variety of dishes

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de leche y azúcar.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member still works at her grocery store business. She has dedicated many years to this business and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts forth every day. She would like to continue working so that she can continue to support her family.

She requests a loan to purchase milk and sugar. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase milk and sugar.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
La socia Susan se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de camaras digitales,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de camaras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar camaras digitales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Susan continues to work at her business where she sells digital cameras. She hopes to be able to move forward with her business. Her dream is to expand her camera sales business.

She requests a loan to purchase digital camers. She is happy with the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase digital cameras.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, flour, rice, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. 

Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of soap, flour, rice, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to have wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will generate more profits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank

loans.use: to buy more stock of soap, flour, rice, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Alfayo

texts.en: Alfayo is a father of three children who describes himself as reliable. He operates a barber shop and has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are men. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of electricity. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a hair-cutting machine. He hopes that in the future, he will live a comfortable life. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buya  hair-cutting machine

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a married mother of three children. She describes herself as innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to open new business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and maximize profits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand ger business

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Evah

texts.en:
Evah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be loving. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Renefe

texts.en:
Renefe is 25 years old and has an agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. She has been farming corn for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Renefe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mourine's Group

texts.en:
Mourine's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Mourine, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children. Mourine has been a farmer for 13 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Mourine isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. 

This year, Mourine will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Mourine's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvests of maize.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna  is a 45-year-old married mother of four children, three currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Edna has a general store business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Edna  has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Edna  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 36 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Evelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional materials for her business, like fishing net, gasoline, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for fishing, like fishing nets, gasoline, and so on

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en:
Samuel is a 35-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in the Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Samuel has noticed that he has had more profit from each harvest.

Samuel described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, along with fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Samuel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Christabel's Group

texts.en:
Christabel is a 34-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader and often is described as a very hard-working individual. She is representing her group of five farmers in the Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Christabel has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Christabel described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, along with fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to rent more land to cultivate. With this loan, Christabel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 2 acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Celestine's Group

texts.en:
Celestine is 33 years old and married with three children. She is a group leader who represents her group of nine farmers from the Butere District, Kenya. Celestine is often described as an extremely hardworking individual. 

Celestine is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Celestine says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has had more profits from each harvest which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Celestine will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

Celestine’s group is requesting a loan to purchase a total of six solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Kolaban est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Sogomougou de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Pièces de pagnes, poissons frits, restauration et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dix-neuvième prêt de groupe.
Batoma qui est un membre du groupe Kolaban, assise 2ème de  gauche à droite, est vendeuse de poissons cuits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des poissons frais, de l’huile alimentaire, du charbon de bois et des condiments (sels, piments, poivre, oignon…) en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle prépare ses poissons pour la vente en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché.    
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kolaban comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200 000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Batoma compte réaliser  215 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Kolaban is a group of women from the district called Sogomougou of the town of Koutiala. They know each other well and live in big traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They have an average age of 35 and at least four children. This group of women sell various items such as lengths of African print cloth, fried fish, cooked food, etc. In order to grow the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 19th group loan. 

Batoma, who is a member of the group called Kolaban, seated second from left to right in the photo, is a seller of fried fish. She intends to use her loan to buy fresh fish, frying oil, charcoal and condiments (salt, red pepper, black pepper, onions, etc.), little by little, as she prepares her fish for retail sale to a diverse clientele. She buys her supplies in the marketplace. 

Whereas the other members of the Kolaban group expect to make an average profit of 200,000 CFA each during this loan cycle, Madame Batoma expects to make 215,000 F CFA. 

Besides reimbursing their loans, the women will use a part of their income to cover personal expenses and grow their working capital. They hope to reinforce this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they will always have ample merchandise.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of cooked food

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilou is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a native basket weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 60 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like coffee, shampoo, hair conditioners, noodles, soft-drinks, soy sauce, etc. Rosalie has been in this business for 6 years.

Rosalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like coffee, shampoo, hair conditioners, noodles, soft-drinks, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Aljane

texts.en:
Aljane is 38 years old and married with one child, who is currently in school, Aljane works very hard to provide for her family.

Aljane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like coffee, eggs, snack foods, biscuits, sugar, and detergent soap to sell.

Aljane has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. 

Aljane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like coffee, eggs, snack foods, biscuits, sugar, and detergent soap to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and also earns more income from fattening pigs. Valentina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Valentina is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Tumika Group

texts.fr:
Cédric fait partie du groupe  Tumika  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 30 ans et est marié  à Fabiola, une  commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 1 à  3 ans.

Il fait le commerce de  téléphones et leurs accessoires depuis 6 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de téléphones et leurs accessoires (batteries, housing,…)   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait faire une entreprise d’informatique et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Cédric is a member of Tumika Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 30 years old and married to Fabiola, a trader. They have two children aged one and three.

Cédric has been selling phones and accessories for six years. This is his third loan from Turame.

The loan granted through Kiva will increase his capital and enable him to buy a large number of phones and accessories (batteries, cases, etc.), which he will resell to increase his income.

In the years to come, Cédric would like to set up an IT business and send his children to school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy phones and accessories (batteries, cases, etc.), which he will resell to increase his income.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 63 years old and married.  

Rosita is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosita has been farming bananas for eight years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Rosita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bonface's Group

texts.en:
Bonface's Group consists of nine farmers in the Butere District and is represented by Bonface, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 37 years old,  married and has four children. Bonface has been a farmer for eight years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Bonface isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has had more profit from each harvest. This year, Bonface will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Bonface's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ivania Sulema

texts.es: Ivania, esta casada, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en un sector suburbano de San Pedro Sula. Tiene su propio  negocio de una pulpería y venta de achinería, este negocio lo tiene hace 5 años en su casa y vende productos como ser granos básicos, refrescos, churros, azúcar, manteca, huevos, embutidos, pan, verduras, condimentos, pastas, productos de aseo etc. Y como achinería vende lociones, cremas, desodorantes y otros. Ha hecho crecer su negocio reinvirtiendo sus ganancias pero necesita capital de trabajo para seguir manteniendo surtido y con varios productos para sus clientes, por eso ha solicitado un préstamo   de 20,000 lempiras, el cual invertirá  en la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, huevos, pan, carnes, embutidos, refrescos, churros, etc. Para tener variedad y aumentar sus ventas. Su plan es seguir apoyando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y su familia.
texts.en: Ivania is 38 years old and married. She has three children and lives with her family in a suburban area of San Pedro Sula. She has her own business operating a convenience store and selling low-cost consumer goods. For five years she has had this business in her house. She sells products such as basic grains, soft drinks, chips, sugar, butter, eggs, cold cuts, bread, vegetables, condiments, pasta, cleaning prducts, etc. For low-cost consumer goods she sells lotions, creams, deodorant and more. She has made her business grow by reinvesting her earnings but she needs working capital to maintain her selection and offer her customers a variety of products. This is why she has requested a loan of 20,000 lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of products such as rice, beans, sugar, butter, eggs, bread, meat, cold cuts, soft drinks, chips, etc. to have variety and increase her sales. Her plan is to continue supporting her husband to defray her family's household expenses.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, butter, eggs, bread, meat, cold cuts, soft drinks, chips, etc.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Butere District. He is 47 years old, married, and has seven children.

Moses likes to think of himself as a very reliable person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learned a lot from farming training programs. Moses plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Moses’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of ten solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Washington's Group

texts.en:
Washington's Group is formed by 6 farmers in the Butere District and is being represented by Washington, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. Washington has been a farmer for 14 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Washington isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to save more money ever since. 

This year, Washington will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Washington's Group will purchase a total of 4 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 2.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvests of maize.

loans.name: Birane

texts.fr: BIRANE est un homme qui évolue dans la couture. Il est marié et père de famille qui habite à coté du guichet et son activité marche très bien avec les événements qui se succèdent  dans son pays. Il a une expérience de plus de 20ans et demande ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter une machine afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses commandes. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de  ses enfants. Il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. A l’avenir, il voudrait avoir trois autres ateliers de couture pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus , élargir le nombre de ses employé, épargner de l’argent et ensuite améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Birane runs a sewing business. He is married and a father, and lives near his place of business.

His business fits in well with the events happening in his country and he has more than 20 years' experience.

Birane is requesting this loan to buy a sewing machine, which will allow him to fulfil the orders he receives. He manages the daily living expenses of his family and the children's school fees. He starts work at 9am and finishes at 8pm.

In the future, Birane would like to expand his business to three additional sewing workshops, which would enable him to increase his income, employ more people, save money and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine in order to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Millicent's Group

texts.en:
Millicent, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Millicent is representing her group of 14 farmers in the Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Millicent has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season.
