Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting, as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Millicent is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 5 acres will be planted by Millicent's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Carolyne's Group

texts.en:
Carolyne's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Carolyne, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children. Carolyne has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Carolyne isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had larger farm group support ever since. 

This year, Carolyne will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since, now, she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Carolyne's Group will purchase a total of 15 solar lights and will use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es:
Marlin es una morena sonriente, extrovertida, alegre, responsable y energitica mujer de 29 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de 9 y 11 años de edad, que gracias a su pareja, al aliento y apoyo que está le da, va a iniciar un negocio de ganado porcino pues busca tener capital para brindar educación a sus hijos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
A través del crédito iniciara comprando cerdos y cuido para engordarlos y alguna adecuaciones para proteger sus animales de las fuertes lluvias.
Este crédito le permitirá a esta madre sentirse importante, ver que aporta para que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones de vida, ver que es capaz de sostener su familia.
texts.en:
Marlin is a dark-skinned, smiling, extroverted, happy, responsible, and energetic woman, age 29, the mother of two children, ages 9 and 11.  Thanks to the encouragement and support her partner gives her, she is going to start a pig business, since she is seeking to have the resources to provide education for her children and improve her living conditions.

Through the loan, she will being buying pigs and animal food to fatten them, and making some adjustments to protect her animals from the strong rains.

This loan will allow this mother to feel important, to see that she contributes to helping her children have better living conditions, and see that she is capable of supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal food to fatten them,

loans.name: Ambrose's Group

texts.en:
Ambrose is a 50-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ambrose has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Ambrose described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to rent more land to cultivate.

With this loan, Ambrose’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Henry's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Henry, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. He is 53 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 10 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.  He is married and has three children.

Henry is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to make more farmer friends in his community, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Henry says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2012, he has learnt a lot from farming training, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Henry will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Magret is a 52-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Magret has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Magret described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is also very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

With this loan, Magret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Medina-coura de la Commune de Koury qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, condiments, habillements, restauration et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois.
Aichata, arrêtée au milieu, est une vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de divers condiments (piments, poivres, sels, gombo, potirons et du soumbala)   en quantité et en qualité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure à Koury. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125 000CFA chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Aichata compte réaliser  150 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of women from the district of Medina-Coura, in the commune of Koury. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives, and they know each other well. They average 37 years of age and three children each. 

These women are resellers of various goods such as condiments, clothing, restaurant services, and others. To expand their activities, the joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, and this is their first group loan cycle. 

One of the group members is a reseller of condiments named Aichata, seen in the group photo standing in the center. She plans to use her loan to replenish her stock of condiments (chilies, peppers, salt, okra, squash and soumbala) as the need arises; she gets her merchandise in Koury and she retails it to a diverse clientele. 

The other group members expect to earn an average profit of 125,000CFA each through this loan cycle. As for Aichata, she expects to earn 150,000FCFA.

In addition to repaying their loans, the group members will use part of their earnings to cover personal expenses and to bolster their capital. They hope to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to ensure that they never run out of stock.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
La socia Ingrid  se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, la socia tiene un carro que hace servicio a la ciudad de lima llevando carga, la socia trabaja 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es comprarse un carro nuevo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ingrid continues devoting herself to her transportation business.  She has a vehicle that she uses to provide a freight transport service to the city of Lima.  

She has been in this business for 7 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to purchase a new vehicle.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase tires for her vehicle.  She is happy about the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 41 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Бактыгул с 1994 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Бактыгул на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы и 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход Бактыгул составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 30 овец. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 41 years old, married, and is raising three children. As a main source of income for her family, Baktygul since 1994 has been raising livestock. On her homestead, Baktygul currently has two cows and 15 sheep. Baktygul's monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her business, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase 30 sheep.

Baktygul plans to invest profits from the loan in further expanding her homestead.

loans.use: to buy 30 sheep in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Richard is a 42-year-old, proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Richard has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Richard described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Richard’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en: Fedelina is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy more groceries to sell in her store. She has been in this business for five years, now. In the future, Fedelina would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en:
Samuel is 65 years old and has 10 children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Samuel is the only person featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group, formed by 13 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Samuel started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011. He decided to do so, because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family. This year he decided to represent his group, because he wanted to help more farmers.

Samuel’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Habillement, huile, produits cosmétiques et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe.
Fatoumata est un membre du groupe Danaya, assise 2ème de  droite à gauche, elle est une vendeuse de friperie. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des balles de  friperie en qualités et en quantité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché.    
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175 000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Fatoumata compte réaliser  180 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women from the Hamdallaye neighborhood in Koutiala and who know each other well. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They are, on average, 32 years old and have at least five children. 

This group of women works selling various goods, such as clothing, oil, cosmetics, and other items. To increase their business, the group members decided to join the loan program with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their third group loan.

Fatoumata, who is seated second from the right [in the photo], sells used clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy bales of quality used clothing in bulk, which she will sell at retail to a diverse clientele. She procures her goods at the market.

While the other group members hope to earn an average profit of 175,000 francs CFA for each cycle, Fatoumata hopes to earn 180,000 francs CFA. 

In addition to paying back their loans, the group also wants to use a part of their earnings to support their personal expenses and increase their business capital. They wish to see their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso strengthened so that their stocks never go run out.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina sigue dedicándose a su negocio de agencia de viajes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo boletos y tours para los distintos tours que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Ernestina is still running her business, a travel agency. She is a responsible and driven person. She continues to sell tour packages and tickets for different events and activities, and this allows her to provide for her family. She is requesting this loan to buy tourist tickets.

She is grateful for the loan she was given previously and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 31 years old, and her one child is in school.

Luzviminda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional materials for her business, like fishing nets, fish containers, gasoline, etc. She has been in this business for six years. Luzviminda would like to save enough, to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business, like fishing nets, fish containers, and gasoline

loans.name: Benson's Group

texts.en:
Benson is a 47-year-old, proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Benson has noticed that he has learned a lot from farming trainings.

Benson says his harvest was good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also purchase a solar light (in addition to fertilizer and maize), because now he will have light during dark hours for his children to study by. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Benson’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jackson's Group

texts.en:
Jackson, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Butere District. He is 60 years old, married, and has six children.

Jackson likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to save more money. Jackson plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Jackson’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон, 39 лет, замужем. Имеет 4 детей, младшей дочери- 5 лет, старшей - 19 лет, она студентка. Семья очень дружная и уважаемая в селе. Чолпон много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес она начала в 2004 году почти с нуля, однако на сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 1 дойная корова, 5 овец. Также у Чолпон в наличии есть земельный надел мерою 1,40 ГА, где она ежегодно выращивает картофель, эспарцет и ячмень. На ежедневной основе Чолпон реализует молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). Всю прибыль от бизнеса Чолпон старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Чолпон хочет увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить условия жизни ее семьи.
texts.en: Cholpon is 39 years old, married, and has four children. Her youngest daughter is five years old, and the eldest is 19 years old and a college student. Cholpon’s close-knit family is well respected in her village. For many years, Cholpon has been raising livestock and growing farm produce. She has launched her business in 2004 almost from nothing. At present she is a successful farmer and has a small farm with one dairy cow and five sheep. Cholpon also has a land plot of 1.4 ha [3.5 acres], where she annually grows potatoes, sainfoin [a herb used for animal feed] and barley. Cholpon also sells milk daily. Her monthly revenue reaches 15,000 KGS. Cholpon tries to invest her revenues in developing her business. She has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy sheep. She would like to increase her livestock headcount and improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрату 29 лет. Он женат имеет одного ребенка , но эта молодая семья планирует в будущем иметь несколько детей. Шухрат имеет свое любимое дело он  слесарь по ремонту автомашин. Своим небольшим доходом он содержит свою молодую семью. С приближением зимы все готовятся к холодам и утепляют жильё. Так и Шухрат своими руками хочет  подготовить свой дом к зиме. Ведь у него маленький ребенок.  Шухрат совмещает  свою работу с ремонтом дома так как для приобретения строительных материалов ему необходимы финансы и время. Чтобы  быть готовыми к зиме осталось совсем мало ведь наступают  холода. Чтобы приобрести необходимые строительные  материалы для утепления кровли он хочет взять кредит и поэтому обратился в «Арванд». Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is 29 years old. He is married and has one child, but this young family plans in the future to have several children. Shuhrat has his favorite trade--he is an automechanic. With his small income he cares for his young family. With winter approaching, everyone is preparing for the cold and insulating the house. Similarly, Shuhrat also wants with his own hands to prepare his home for the winter. Especially since he has a small child.

Shuhrat combines his work with home repairs since in order to purchase construction materials he needs financing and time. In order to be ready for winter there remains very little time before the cold arrives. In order to purchase the needed construction materials for insulating the roof, he wants to take a loan and therefore applied to Arvand. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Benkan est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Souroukoukin de la Commune de Koury qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, condiments, fruits et légume et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois.
Kanou qui est un membre du groupe Benkan, assise 2ème de la gauche vers la  droite, est une vendeuse de fruits et légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de fruits et légumes (patates, papaye, tomates) en quantité et en qualité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure à Koury. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkan comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 135 000CFA chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Kanou compte réaliser  155 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The women in Benkan Group live in the Souroukoukin district of Koury. They know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. On average, they are 37 years old and have at least four children.

The women sell various items, including condiments, and fruit and vegetables. To expand their businesses, the members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan scheme for the first time.

Kanou, a member of Benkan Group, is pictured sitting second from the left. She sells fruit and vegetables, and will use her loan to buy a large quantity of quality potatoes, papaya and tomatoes. She buys her supplies in Koury, and sells her produce to a mixed clientele.

While the other members of Benkan Group hope to make 135,000 CFA francs each over the loan cycle, Kanou hopes to make 155,000 CFA francs.

In addition to repaying the loan, the group members will use their earnings to pay personal expenses and increase their business funds. They would like to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to ensure they can maintain their stocks.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Rangina

texts.en:
Rangina founded Kandahar Treasure in 2008 to help the women of Kandahar sustain their lives through Khamak, the unique embroidery that the women of this region have been embroidering for centuries.  Khamak is an art form that has traditionally been used in cultural assets as such as bridal trousseau, baby sets and men's traditional attire. Kandahar Treasure has now brought this art form to the world market to not only help revive the tradition of the art work but also sustains and empowers women in the process.  

This loan will allow Kandahar Treasure to grow through increased productivity. The sewing machines will improve the quality of the products while also allowing the women to produce more products in a timely fashion. In addition, the female artisans travel everyday to Kandahar Treasure by foot. Not only does this take hours out of their workday, but it also can be very unsafe. The loan will also be used to provide transportation which will allow for improved safety and more quality hours of production time.  

Kandahar Treasure has increasing market opportunities both inside Afghanistan as well as internationally and the business continues to grow. The success of Kandahar Treasure is a great example to the world that women in one of the world's most dangerous parts can achieve self-sufficiency with a traditional skill of creativity. Hopefully it can serve as inspiration for the rest of the world, where life might not be as harsh and as unstable as Kandahar, to be able to succeed in many projects.  Kandahar Treasure is committed to pushing its standards for excellence and hopes to revive the war-torn nation of Afghanistan one stitch at a time.

loans.use: To buy 9 sewing machines that will increase productivity and to provide safer transportation to the female workers.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years. Now, he is now proud to represent his group of 16 farmers in Butere District. He is 39 years old, is married, and has six children.

Peter likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013. He decided to represent his group, because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Peter plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Peter’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 10.25 acres of land. Some members of the group will also purchase a solar light with this loan. The group will receive a total of nine solar lights, in addition to the farm inputs (seeds and fertilizer).

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer, to improve his maize harvest

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Kotogongotala est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, bois de chauffage, beurres de Karité et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe.
Mariam qui est un membre du groupe Kotognogotala, assise au bout et à gauche, est une vendeuse bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de chargement de bois de chauffe en qualités et en quantité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché.    
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kotognogotala comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165 000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Mariam compte réaliser  170 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Kotogongotala is a group of women from the Hamdallaye neighborhood in Koutiala, who know each other well. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They are, on average, 44 years old and have at least five children. 

This group of women works selling various goods, such as firewood, shea butter, and other items. To increase their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their third group loan.

Mariam, who is seated first on the left, sells firewood. She plans to use her loan to buy a load of quality firewood in bulk, which she will sell at retail to a diverse clientele. She procures her goods at the market.

While the other Kotognogotala group members hope to earn an average profit of 165,000 francs CFA, Mariam hopes to earn 170,000 francs CFA. 

In addition to paying back their loans, the group members will also use a part of their earnings to support their personal expenses and increase their business funds. They wish to see their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso strengthened so that their stocks never run out.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Seydina Djibril

texts.fr: SEYDINA est un jeune homme qui habite dans le même quartier que le guichet. Il est célibataire sans enfant et évolue dans l’aviculture. Il a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des poussins et de l’aliment pour pratiquer l’aviculture. Il n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution et a comme charge ses frais scolaires. Il commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 22h.  A l’avenir il souhaite avoir un grand poulailler au niveau de son périmètre agricole afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et payer les frais scolaires et épargner de l’argent. Ainsi, il pourra acheter une maison et former une famille.
texts.en:
Seydina is a young man who lives in the same area as the [UIMCEC] branch. He is single and has no children. 

Seydina works in poultry farming, which he has been doing for more than five years. He is seeking a loan to buy chicks and food so that he can conduct his business. His parents are not beneficiaries of UIMCEC, so he must pay his own school fees.

He starts his day at 10 a.m. and finishes at 10 p.m. 

In the future, he wishes to have a large chicken coop on his land in order to be able to increase his earnings, which he will use to pay his school fees and to save.

Seydina would especially like to be able to buy a house and start a family.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Dúo Florecitas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
Dúo Florecitas de Vista Hermosa
La encargada de este grupo es doña Gloria quien se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de paca seleccionada y la venta de cosméticos en general como lociones, talcos, champo, cremas, desodorantes, para damas y caballeros.  Tiene 6 años de estar vendiendo y tiene un pequeño local en su casa, por la calle principal de su colonia.  Su sueño es llegar a tener una venta muy grande de ropa para dama y caballero pero que sea nueva y llegar a tener varias vendedoras de cosméticos para así ayudar a muchas mujeres que necesitan una oportunidad de trabajo para sacar adelante a sus hijos.  Contando con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y sus hijos, le da gracias a Dios por la venta que tiene.  Las buenas fechas están a punto de llegar y le hace falta mucha ropa para poder ofrecer calidad y variedad a sus clientes por tal motivo necesita comprar una paca completa que le vale mil quinientos quetzales y un poco de cremas, lociones, y desodorantes y así aprovechar los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The leader of this group is Doña Gloria, who makes her living from the sale of pre-worn clothes that come in large packages and the sale of cosmetics in general, including lotions, powders, shampoo, creams, and deodorants, for both men and women. She has six years of experience selling her merchandise and she has a small store insider her home, by the main street in her community.

Her dream to get to have very large sales of clothing for men and women and that all the clothes she sells are new. She also dreams of having many saleswomen for the cosmetics in order to help many women who need job opportunities so that they can provide a better future for their children. Counting on the unconditional support of her husband and her children, she gives thanks to God for the sales she has.

The good profits are about to come and she lacks a lot of clothing to be able to offer quality and variety to her customers. For this reason, she needs to buy a complete pack of clothing that is worth 1,500 quetzales and a few creams, lotions, and deodorants. This way she can take advantage of all the orders she has.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Komil

texts.ru: У Комила большая семья . Они с женой растят четверых детей. Старшие дети подросли и уже помогают родителям внося свой вклад в общий бюджет семьи.   Старший сын на заработках в России.  У Комила свой бизнес он  занимается тем, что продает муку на  городском рынке.  Повзрослевших детей ему уже необходимо женить и для организации свадебных мероприятий ему потребуется  больше средств. С этой целью Комил хочет расширить свой бизнес, ведь он приобретает муку с разных  отдаленных рынков и у него много затрат на  перевозку груза. Для приобретения  новой  партии груза ему недостает немного денег . Комил обратился в Арванд, в надежде , что «Арванд»  поможет ему  и заранее благодарен.
texts.en: Komil has a large family. He and his wife are raising four children. The older children are grown and are already helping their parents to contribute to the general family budget. The eldest son is working abroad in Russia. Komil has his own business; he is engaged in selling flour at the town market. Because the children are grown, it is already necessary for him to put on a wedding and to organize a wedding celebration and he needs more money. With this goal, Komil wants to expand his business, though because he gets the flour from various distant markets he has many expenses for shipping. He does not have enough money to purchase a new parcel of cargo. Komil applied to Arvand with the hope that they will help him and he is grateful in advance.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат 50 летняя женщина которая проживает в сельской местности.Замужем имеет 3 детей. Её муж Иброхим занимается производством сырого кирпича на дому.Так как заработок мужа недостаточен обеспечить семью, Рохат помогает мужу содержать семью и работает на центральном рынке купля продажей продуктов питания. Так как её денежные средства недостаточно для оборота она обратилась в "Арванд" за поддержкой. Рохат благодарна "Арванд" за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Rohat is a 50-year-old woman who resides in the countryside. She is married and has three children. Her husband Ibrokhim produces raw bricks at their home. Since her husband's income is not enough to support the family, Rohat helps her husband to care for the family and works in the central market buying and selling groceries. Since her monetary resources are not enough for turnover, she applied to Arvand for support. Rohat is thankful to Arvand for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Lafia est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Medina-coura de la Commune de Koury qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 anset ont au moins 4enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, condiments, et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois.
Djeneba qui est un membre du groupe Lafia, arrêtée 2ème de la gauche vers la droite, est une vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de divers condiments (piments, poivres, sels de cuisine, gombo, Cube Maggi, potiron et des tomates)  en quantité et en qualité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure à Koury. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Lafiacomptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120.000CFA chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Djeneba compte réaliser  140 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Lafia is a group of women in the Medina-coura neighborhood in the Koury commune who know each other well. They all live in traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They are, on average, 39 years old and have at least four children.

This group of women works selling various goods, such as condiments and other goods. To increase their business, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program for the first time.

Djeneba, who is standing second from the left [in the photo], sells condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy various quality condiments (hot peppers, peppers, cooking salt, okra, Maggi cubes, pumpkin, and tomatoes) in bulk, which she will resell at retail to a diverse clientele. She procures her goods in Koury.

While the other members of the group hope to earn an average profit of 120,000 francs CFA each cycle, Djeneba hopes to earn 140,000 francs CFA.

In addition to repaying the loans, the group members will use a part of their earnings to support their personal expenses and increase their business funds. They wish to see their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso strengthened so that their stocks never run out.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Jakelyn Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia Jakelyn Eulogia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Jakelyn Eulogia still works selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses, and shirts. She has been in this business for several years and things are going very well for her. Her dream is to open a store. 

She is requesting this loan to buy shoes, shirts, sweaters, polo shirts, and blouses. She is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Alma Iris

texts.es: Doña Alma es una mujer con mucho ánimo de superación, y laboriosa en su negocio; casada, y tiene la edad de 38 años, dedicándose a la venta de comida en su domicilio desde hace cinco años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de gaseosas, granos básicos, repostería, frutas, verduras, mesas y sillas para el crecimiento del negocio. Ella tiene varios ciclos trabajando con la institución ADIM y ha sabido aprovechar el dinero en la inversión y mejoramiento del hogar. Es honesta y responsable en las fechas de pago.
texts.en:
Alma is a woman with a lot of energy for self-improvement who is hard-working in her business. She is 38 years old, is married, and has made a living selling food from her home for the last five years. 

She is requesting this loan to buy carbonated drinks, basic grains, confectionery, fruits, vegetables, tables and chairs for the growth of her business. She has been working with ADIM for a few cycles and has made good use of the money for investments and home improvements. She is honest and responsible with her payment dates.

loans.use: to buy carbonated drinks, basic grains, confectionery, fruits, vegetables, tables and chairs for the growth of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to furnish his home

loans.name: Dúo Cosechando Con Amor Group

texts.es:
DUO COSECHANDO CON AMOR
Doña Fermina  es originaria de la Aldea  Pacorral Tecpan, ella tiene 43 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad estan sus tres hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
El esposo de ella trabaja como agricultor y gracias al apoyo de Él y el de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que es el medio que ella tiene para salir adelante con su familia.
Ella a empezado este negocio desde hace algunos años y gracias a Dios poco a poco su negocio a crecido ya ahora le hacen pedidos de tejidos o servilletas y eso la a ayudo para mejorar su negocio.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio ya que asi ella tendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor ya que hoy en dia la educación es muy importante en la vida de los jóvenes.
texts.en:
Fermina belongs to Duo Cosechando Con Amor and is from the village of Pacorral Tecpan. She is 43 years old and is raising her three minor children. She works making handmade traditional textiles and raising animals. Her husband works as a farmer and thanks to her husband and her children's support she keeps her business running and is able to provide for the family. 

She started her business several years ago and thankfully it has grown little by little. Now she is getting orders for textiles or napkins, and that helps her improve her business. Her dream is to further expand her business in order to make more profit, support her children, and send them to school so they can have a better future because in this day and age education is very important for young people's lives.

loans.use: to buy materials to make and sell traditional textiles.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she has been able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

Now she would like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan. She will use this loan as part of her working capital, to buy a larger quantity of the grocery items that she sells at retail, like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and, thus, increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and the education of her children. She is thanking God and you, in advance, for the financial help that will be given her.

Amelita dreams of having a bigger general store, and aims to give her children the best education, to ensure them of a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.


*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for inventory needed in her business, including grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Wendy Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En casi un año, Wendy  de 33 años de edad, ha ido evolucionando a pasos agigantados y se siente muy agradecida por ello. De ser una comerciante de gaseosas y golosinas, llegó a establecer una pulpería completa desde el préstamo anterior, donde pudo comprar más productos para diversificar su negocio. Por esta razón ella se siente muy agradecida con todas las personas que le extendieron la mano. 
Ahora la pequeña pulpería de Wendy ya tiene más de dos años y cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien dirige el negocio cuando ella está trabajando como docente en un colegio privado. Como mujer con mucho deseo de superación, desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar golosinas, pan, arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, entre otros. Con el fin de seguir incrementando las distintas marcas y productos de gran demanda. Entre sus planes está ahorrar para cambiar el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Wendy, 33, has grown in leaps and bounds in just about a year, and she's very grateful for that.  She went from selling sodas and snacks to setting up a complete grocery store.  Since her last loan, she managed to buy more products to diversify her business.  She's very grateful to all the people who gave her a hand.

Now Wendy's little grocery store is almost two years old.  She has the help of her mother, who manages the business when Wendy's working as a teacher in a private school.

Wendy wants to keep on investing in her business because she's a woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  She's requesting a loan to buy snacks, bread, rice, sugar, sodas, and other products so she can keep on increasing the different brands and products in high demand.

One of her plans is to replace the roof on her house.

loans.use: to buy snacks, bread, rice, sugar, soda, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en: Guillermo is originally from Ecuador. He moved to the United States in order to be with his two daughters who live here. He left behind his home town, his career as an accountant and, especially his family, just to be with his daughters. When he got to the States, he began working as a driver. Then he saw the opportunity to be an owner/operator and he took it. Initially, he rented a truck. Then he bought a second-hand one.

loans.use: To repair his truck and replace its tires

loans.name: Zacharia's Group

texts.en:
Zacharia is a 40-year-old, proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual and he is representing his group of 15 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Zacharia has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Zacharia described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Zacharia’s Group will be able to plant a total of seven acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dúo Bosque Encontrado Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bosque Encontrado
Formado por Anastasia de 25 años de edad se dedica a la crianza de pollos es una persona responsable y lucha diario en su negocio para obtener así mas ganancias y ayudar así a sus hijos para que estudian, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de avez de corral(pollos) para la crianza, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: The communal bank "Dúo Bosque Encontrado" was started up by Anastasia, who is 25 years old.  She works raising chickens.  She is a responsible person who struggles daily in her business to generate more earnings to help her children so that they can stay in school.  She is requesting this loan to buy barnyard fowl to raise.  She is hoping that you will help her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy su estado civil es soltera, reside en el distrito de La Matanza, ella es natural de la zona, vive en casa propia, junto a su familia. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, además del comercio. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Nancy es la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora; además también se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino, actividad que realiza desde hace más 15 años, Nancy cuenta con buenas referencias en la zona y crediticias. El destino del crédito será para la compra de maíz en mayor cantidad, es decir al por mayor, para ella poder realizar en cantidades mayores su producción y así poder cumplir con toda la demanda que ella tiene. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy is single and resides in the district of La Matanza. She is a native to this area and lives in her own house together with her family. Life is her community is quiet and the people work in agriculture, raising livestock as well as commerce. Her community is located in the district of La Matanza, the province of Morropón, Piura region on the North Coast of Peru.

Nancy works making and selling chicha de jora (corn beer). She also raises animals and sells goats, an activity she has done for more than 15 years. Nancy has good references and a good loan record in the area. The loan will be used to buy corn in greater quantities, that is to say wholesale, so that she can have higher production and supply the demand that she has. In the short term this will allow her to increase her income and profits and in the end improve the quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of corn.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otila tiene 54 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposo e hijo, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Otila se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como patos y gallinas, desde hace más de 10 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde balanceado para sus animales de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Otila, 54, is married and lives with her husband and child in her own house.  They live in a large community in the urban part of Cayalti.  She has good personal and work references from her neighbors.  People in her area mainly work in agriculture, livestock production, and commerce.  This area is in the Cayalti district of Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

Otila has a business raising and selling animals such as ducks and hens.  Her business is more than 10 years old, and is located on her property.  Otila is requesting a loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals so that her business will grow.  This will allow her to increase her income over a short period.  With higher earnings, she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her business

loans.name: Niyokindi Group

texts.fr:
Marthe  fait partie du groupe  Niyokindi et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 42 ans et est marie à Bernard un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 4 à 22 ans, dont 4 étudient.
Elle a  sous sa charge son frère qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de poissons, de tomates et d’aubergines depuis 4 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une  grande quantité de poissons et de tomates à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Marthe is a part of the Niyokindi group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 42 years old and is married to Bernard, a merchant. Together they have six children, aged from four to 22 years old. Four of the children attend school. She also takes care of her brother, who also attends school.

Marthe has worked selling fish, tomatoes, and eggplants for four years. This is her fifth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large number of fish and tomatoes, which she will resell to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a pice of land and see her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy a large number of fish and tomatoes

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es: José, tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo y reside en un sector suburbano de San Pedro Sula. El trabajó por varios años en una fabrica privada de condimentos, y al quedar sin empleo decidió por su propio negocio. Hace dos años que vende un poco de todo, elabora piñatas, flores, coronas,  vende bisutería, juguetes, novedades y algo de calzado. Este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa y es la fuente de ingresos familiar. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar materia prima como es flores, alambre, papel china, pegamento,para elaborar arreglos florales y coronas para la época del día de difuntos y elaboración de piñatas. Va aprovechar la temporada para aumentar las ventas. Su plan es seguir ampliando el negocio actual y poner otro negocio para generar mas ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and is in a common-law-marriage. He lives with his wife and their son in a suburb of San Pedro Sula. For several years he worked at a private factory packing spices. When he became unemployed he decided to start his own business. For the past two years he has been selling a little bit of everything. He makes piñatas, flowers, and wreaths, and he sells costume jewelry, toys, novelty items, and some shoes. His business is located in his home and is his family's source of income.

He has decided to request a loan in the amount of 10,000 lempiras to buy materials like flowers, wire, tissue paper, and glue to make floral arrangements, funeral wreaths, and piñatas. He plans to make the most of the season to improve his sales. In the long run, he plans to keep expanding his current business and start a second one in order to generate more income for his household.

loans.use: to buy materials like flowers, wire, tissue paper, and glue to make floral arrangements, funeral wreaths, and piñatas.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina 54, is married and the mother of four children. They live in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son provides transportation services in Lahore. He has driven a rickshaw for many years. He wants to buy new rickshaw body because current rickshaw's body rattled during driving.

Sakina has therefore requested a loan to help her son with this purchase. They are hopeful for a better future. They thank Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw body for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Las Compañeras Group

texts.es: Grupo Las compañeras está integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas, y coordinado por la señora Rosa quien tiene la edad de 63 años, casada, y se dedica a la venta de refrescos y nacatamales en su domicilio desde hace diez años, tienen varios ciclos financiados por la institución ADIM, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de frutas, bolsas, hojas de chagüites, mecates, pollo, carne, quintales de maíz, y manteca; una de sus metas es pagar puntual para gozar de un buen récord crediticio en la institución y lograr que le sigan financiando para el crecimiento de su negocio. Maryuri es otra de las integrantes del grupo, tiene la edad de 28 años y comercializa cosméticos AVON y variedades de ropa desde hace diez años en su comunidad y Karen quien tiene la edad de 32 años y comercializa ropa, prendas y calzados desde hace cinco años en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Compañeras" is made up of 3 hardworking women.  The coordinator of the group is Rosa, who is 62 years old and married.  Rosa has a business selling drinks and nacatamales (steamed corncakes).  She's had this business in her home for 10 years, and has gone through a number of loan cycles with the ADIM institution.  She is now requesting a loan to buy fruit, bags, plantain leaves, twine, chicken, meat, butter, and 100 lb. sacks of corn.  One of her goals is to pay off her loan on time so that she can maintain a good credit record with the institution.  This way she can continue to obtain financing to grow her business. 

Maryuri is one of the other members of the group.  She is 28 years old, and has been working selling Avon cosmetics and clothing in her community for 10 years.  The other member, Karen, is 32 and has been working in her community selling clothing and shoes for 5 years.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Dúo Ebenezer De Patzun Group

texts.es: Dúo Ebenezer de Patzun, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Irma Yolanda de 37 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica en diferentes estilo ya que la epoca de fin de año se aserca y nececita capital para invertir y asi de la misma manera generar mas ganancias y ayudar a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
The "Dúo Ebenezer de Patzun" Group includes Señora Irma Yolanda, age 37. 

She has been selling traditional clothing for several years; and  on this occasion, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of different styles of traditional clothing, as the end of the year is approaching and she needs capital for this investment. 

In this way, she will generate more earnings and help her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and fertilize his cocoa crop.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Her name is Amanda, and she is aged 55 years. She is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She has three children, of whom one is in High School and the other two are already working. She manages her household, while operating the business. She works hard to provide income to meet their daily personal, household needs, and to send her children to school.

Amanda has operated a general store for six years, already. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities, directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items or food. It is the place to go, to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 500 a day.

To help her continue the operation of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 8000 loan. She will use it to buy grocery items (such as sacks of rice and soda), charcoal, and other things. She is the supplier of soft drinks for the whole airbase near the family's home. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you, in advance, for the financial help that will be given her.

Amanda hopes to maintain and grow her business, so she and her family could have a better life. She strives to hard to give her children the best education and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Lynett's Group

texts.en:
Lynett's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Butere District. The group is being represented by Lynett, who is the group leader and is pictured, above. She is 29 years old, is married, and has two children. Lynett has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Lynett isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012. Since then, she has noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest. This year, Lynett will get not only fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save money.

Using this loan, Lynett's Group will purchase a total of 6 solar lights and plant a total of 6.75 acres with the farm inputs they will receive.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvest

loans.name: Vyukadukore Group

texts.fr:
Rose  fait partie du groupe  Vyukadukore et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 45 ans .Elle a 2 enfants l’un  a 21 et l’autre 22, tous  étudient.
Elle a  sous sa charge un enfant membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de charbons de bois depuis 20  ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une  grande quantité de charbons de bois   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait avoir son propre capital  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Vyukadukore group and lives in Bujumbura. She is a widow and 45 years old. She has two children, who are 21 and 22 years old. Both go to school. She also takes care of an child from her extended family, who also attends school.

Rose has worked selling charcoal for 20 years. She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large amount of charcoal, which she will resell to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to have her own capital and see her children [continue to] go to school.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Adash

texts.ru: Адаш 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 4 детей. У Адаш - высшее образование, она пенсионерка и работает бухгалтером, дополнительно с 1991 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Адаш очень любит свою деятельность, на земельной доле 2,70 ГА она выращивает картофель и клевер. Также в хозяйстве есть 9 коров и лошадей, 110 овец, также Адаш реализует молоко на ежедневной основе. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). Накопленные средства стараются вкладывать в образование и воспитание детей и внуков, а также в развитие бизнеса. Также Адаш улучшает жилищные условия, до наступления зимы она хочет построить веранду и навес. Поэтому Адаш обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Благодаря кредиту, Адаш сможет откладывать доходы от бизнеса на его развитие.
texts.en: Adash is 54, married, and raising four children together with her husband.  She has a university education, is collecting a pension, and is currently working as an accountant.  In addition, she has been growing crops and raising livestock since 1991 to earn some extra money.  She really loves farming, and currently has 2.70 hectares of land for growing potatoes and clover.  She also has 9 cows and horses, as well as 110 sheep, and sells milk from her farm every day.  Her monthly income is roughly 18,000 som.  She has been trying to save money for her children and grandchildren's education in addition to expanding her business.  She has also been trying to improve her living conditions, and wants to build a veranda and a shed before the onset of winter.  To that end, she is seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy construction materials, which in turn will allow her to reinvest her normal income back into her business.

loans.use: buy construction materials to build a veranda and a shed

loans.name: Ines

texts.pt:
A senhora Ines tem 56 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de quatro filhos, dos quais três estão nos seus lares e uma está sub sua responsabilidade. Para além da sua filha, sustenta ainda dois netos que frequentam o ensino secundário.
 Com o financiamento, vai comprar pedaços de frangos desde moelas, pele de frango, pescoços, patas de frangos, cabeças de frangos. Para além deste produto, vende ainda mariscos, peixe, camarão, lagosta e lulas.
 O seu sonho é possuir uma mercearia bem grande para que possa vender  todos produtos, pese embora enfrenta dificuldades financeiras, o seu  desafio é  reembolsar o empréstimo há tempo para poder solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Ines, 56, is a widow and a mother of four children. Three of her children are in their own homes and one is under her responsibility. In addition to her daughter, she also supports two grandchildren who are in secondary school.

With this loan, she will buy cuts of chicken, such as gizzards, skin, necks, feet, and heads. Aside from these products, she also sells shellfish, fish, shrimp, lobsters, and squid. 

Her dream is to own a very large grocery store so that she can sell all products, though she is currently facing financial difficulties. Her challenge is to pay back the loan so that she can apply for more loans.

loans.use: to buy cuts of chicken, such as gizzards, skin, necks, feet, and heads.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products to make snacks.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Butere District. The group is being represented by Rosemary, who is the group leader and is pictured, above. She is 33 years old, is married, and has three children. Rosemary has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Rosemary isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012. Since then she has noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to put more money into savings. This year, Rosemary will get not only fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money.

Using this loan, Rosemary's Group will purchase a total of 6 solar lights and plant a total of 5.5 acres with the farm inputs they will receive.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvest

loans.name: Lucrencia

texts.pt:
A sra Lucrencia tem 50 anos de idade, casada e mae de quatro filhos, todos vivem com ela. Para alem dos seus filhos, vivem tambem com os seus dois netinhos e a sua nora.
 Com o empréstimo, pretende reforçar o seu negócio de venda de produtos da hortifrutícola tais como folhas de abóbora, tomate, cebola, frutas diversificadas, e produtos de tecelagem.
O seu sonho é ampliar o seu negócio, olhando para as necessidades do mercado actual.
O desafio é reembolsar o crédito dentro do prazo acordado, embora, o mercado é concorrencial, ou seja, há muita gente que vende o mesmo tipo de produtos que ela vende.
texts.en:
Lucrencia, 50, is married and a mother of four children, all of whom are living with her. Aside from her children, she also lives with her two little grandchildren and her daughter-in-law.

With this loan, she plans to strengthen her business selling fruit and vegetable products, such as pumpkin leaves, tomatoes, onions, various fruits, and woven products. 

Her dream is to expand her business, looking at the needs of the current market.

Her challenge is to repay the loan within the agreed timeframe, although the market is competitive; in other words, there are many people selling the same type of products as her.

loans.use: to buy pumpkin leaves, tomatoes, onions, and various fruits.

loans.name: Julia Melcy

texts.es:
Julia Melcy tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente de frutales, café y arroz, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Julia Melcy es brindar el servicio de computación en el centro de salud del distrito de Colasay realiza labores como ingresos y egresos de pacientes y demás cosas conserniente a trámites documentarios, Julia Melcy cuenta con 1 año dedicandose a este rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de una computadora con mayor tecnología para poder darle un valor agregado a su servicio y mejorar la atención del mismo. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Julia Melcy, 33, lives with her husband and children in the Pucara district.  This is a community with a hot climate where the residents work in agriculture (fruits, coffee, and rice), commerce, and livestock production.  This community is located in Jaen province, which is in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.

Julia Melcy has a business providing computer services in a health center in Colasay district.  She does work such as admitting and discharging patients, and other paperwork and documents.  Julia Melcy has been in this line of work for a year.  She will use this loan to buy a computer with better technology so that she can add value to her services and take better care of her customers.  There is not much competition in this line of work in her area, and so with this investment she will be able to charge higher prices.

loans.use: to buy a computer with better technology

loans.name: Timinadiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIMINADIYA est constitué de 5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  légumes à l’image de SITAN qui est la 3ème femme assise dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 sacs de potiron, 4 sacs de choux avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Timinadiya group is made up of five married women who, on average, are 34 years old and have five children. They live in nuclear families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in Bougouni. The women know each other from neighborhood, friendship and business ties. To strengthen their financial capacity in order to better conduct their businesses, the women joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their first loan.

This group of women works selling vegetables, like Sitan, who is seated third from the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy five sacs of pumpkins and four sacs of cabbage from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She will make her sales at the market and from home, at retail, for cash and credit, to a mixed group of customers.

Sitan hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested back into her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Elida Nataly

texts.es:
Elida es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene una hija pequeña quien se ha convertido en el motor de su vida y por quien siempre lucha para poder brindarle lo mejor. Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como Operario en un fundo agrícola, cada mañana sale muy temprano y labora durante todo el día, por más de 8 horas para poder tener mayores ingresos con los cuales pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Sus tiempos libres le gusta dedicarlos as u hija, a enseñarle las tareas, salir a pasear con ella porque es el mejor regalo que la vida ha podido darle.
Elida quiere ahorrar dinero para poder mejorar su vivienda y para velar por el futuro de su hija, es por ello que con el crédito otorgado piensa comprarse una moto para trasladarse de su casa a su trabajo y así ahorrar en pasajes que ahora le sale costoso. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad y más adelante espera poder cumplir su sueño de ver a su hija convertida en un a excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Elida is a very hard-working woman with a strong desire to get ahead, She has a young daughter who is the driving force in her life. She always strives to provide the best for her. For more than a year, she has worked on a farm. Every morning, she leaves very early and works all day, for more than 8 hours, in order to earn more income which she can use to improve her family's quality of life. She likes to dedicate her free time to her daughter, teaching her to do her chores, and going on walks with her because she is the best gift that life has given her. 

Elida wants to save money so that she can improve her home and look out for her daughter's future. Therefore, with this loan, she plans on buying a motorcycle to get from home to work, saving on transit fares, which are expensive. She is very grateful for the generosity of the lenders on Kiva. In the future, she would like to fulfill her dream of seeing her daughter become an excellent professional.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transportation from her home to her job

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Her name is Margaret, 38, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is single and has her own business to support herself and help her aging parents. 

Margaret has operated a general store for five years already. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

Margaret earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells popular brands of direct-selling products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, Margaret is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items, such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, and direct-selling beauty products, as well. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her.

Margaret hopes to maintain and grow her business. She dreams of going abroad to earn more money and invest her income in other businesses, so she could support her parents in their old age. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and direct-selling personal products to sell.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto is a 23-year-old Ugandan male, married to Sylivia, with whom they have one two-year-old child.

Benedicto is a businessman and he operates a retail shop, but besides that, he is also a farmer and a produce dealer.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to buy merchandise to stock in his retail shop. Despite the challenges of competition, he thinks if he gets a boost, he can do better and get more profits.

Benedicto's dreams for the future are to expand his business and acquire a vehicle to assist him in the produce business. He describes himself as hard-working and honest in business.

loans.use: to buy retail stock items to sell.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо молодая  девушка. Ей 28 лет. Образование у Мархабо среднее.  С детства Мархабо любила шить платья для своих кукол и теперь повзрослев она  воплотила свои детские мечты в реальность  и стала швеей. Она шьет национальные платья для женшин. Живет вместе с родителями и помогает им . Отец Мархабо на заработках в России . В семье у нее еще есть братья и сестры. Хотя  она не получила высшего образования Мархабо довольна тем занятием , которым сейчас занимается. Ведь это дело любимое. Она сама старается моделировать национальные платья и так как вкладывает в дело все свои старания и платья у нее получаются очень красивыми. Для  приобретения хорошего швейного оборудования Мархабо берет заем в «Арванде» Она искренне верит , что любовь к своему делу и поддержка «Арванд»  поможет ей стать боле успешной.
texts.en: Marhabo is a young woman. She is 28 years old. Marhabo has a secondary education. Since childhood, Marhabo loved to sew dresses for her dolls and now, having grown up, she realized her childhood dreams and became a seamstress. She sews national dresses for women. She lives with her parents and helps them. Marhabo's father works in Russia. She also has brothers and sisters. Despite the fact that she did not obtain a higher education, Marhabo is happy with her current occupation. This is the work she loves. She tries to model national dresses herself and, because she invests all of her skills into the business, her dresses come out to be very beautiful.
