Marhabo is requesting a loan from "Arvand" to buy good sewing equipment. She sincerely believes that the love for her business and support from "Arvand" will help her become more successful.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Sra Maria de 62 anos de idade, viuva, mae de sete filhos, onze netos, todos na sua responsablidade. Salientar que a su base de sobrevivencia é negócio e machamba.
 Ela precisa do empréstimo para comprar produtos alimentares diversos como arroz, peixe, refregerantes e bebidas para revender. Para além deste negócio, vive também de negócio de produtos da machamba.
O seu maior sonho é tornar o seu negocio mais amplo e rentável do que está a render actualmente, porém, o seu desafio é cuidar dos seus netos e as dificuldades que ela enfrenta, são financeiras.
texts.en:
Maria, 62, is a widow and a mother with seven children and eleven grandchildren, all of whom are under her responsibility. Her means of subsistence is a small farm business.

She needs this loan to buy food products such as rice, fish, soda, and drinks to resell. Aside from this business, she also lives from her business selling products from the farm.

Her greatest dream is to expand her business and make it more profitable than it currently is. However, her challenge is to take care of her grandchildren. The difficulties she faces are financial ones.

loans.use: to buy various food products such as rice, fish, soda, and drinks to resell.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo entre otros, la socia vende la comida a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en: This member continues to work at her business selling food, making different types of dishes such as chicken and rice, among others. She sells the food to anyone who requests it. She is a very responsible and diligent person, with this being the way in which she supports her family. She requests this loan in order to buy rice, oil, and other supplies. She is very grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
El socio Saturnino se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ferreteria,el socio vende clavos, pinturas y alambres, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y alambres.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Saturino continues making his living from the sale of hardware. Saturino sells nails, paint, and wires. He works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. He has already been working in this business for many years and it is going very well for him.

His dream is to expand his hardware business. Saturino is requesting this loan to buy nails, paint, and wires. He is happy to have the loan and he promises to make all of the payments.

loans.use: to buy nails, paint, and wires.

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es:
BELLANIRE mujer trabajadora de 34 años de edad. tiene 2 hijas de 13 y 15 años que asisten a clases con normalidad.
BELLANIRE es madre soltera y desde hace varios años vive en un barrio muy pobre de SAN LORENZO.
ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de sabanas - toallas - toldos y cortinas para el adorno del hogar.
este negocio lo realiza en el tiempo libre que le queda luego de trabajar en una guardería como cocinera.
ella tiene el anhelo de ver su negocio mas organizado. tener en un corto tiempo unas vitrina donde poder exhibir su mercadería y dejar de exponerse al peligro constante de ofrecer sus productos en forma ambulante y ser victima de asaltos.
BELLANIRE nos dice que FODEMI viene a ser un beneficio que ayuda a personas con escasas posibilidades a través de un crédito para negocio.
ella se considera una persona muy humilde con deseos de superación y colaboración al prójimo.
texts.en: Bellanire is a hardworking woman who is 34 years old.  She has two daughters, 13 and 14 years old that attend regular classes.  Bellanire is a single mother and for several years, lives in a very poor neighborhood of San Lorenzo.  She has a small business selling sheets, towels, blinds, and curtains for home decoration.  She does this business in the free time that she has after working in a nursery as a cook.  Bellanire has the desire of seeing her business more organized, and in a short time to have a showcase where she can display her merchandise and to stop being exposed to constant danger, offering her products outside and being a victim of assaults.  Bellanire tells us that FODEMI becomes a benefit that helps people with limited opportunities through business credits.  She considers herself a very humble person with hopes of overcoming and collaborating with her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy and sell sheets, towels, blinds, and curtains for home decoration.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 55 years old and is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Pablito, a retired policeman, and they have 2 kids. The eldest is already working, and the youngest is in high school. Conchita manages their household and works to support her family and cover her child's school expenses.

Conchita has a backyard hog farm and has been doing this for a number of years already. Investing in hog rearing is a good and profitable business. Female pigs conceive twice a year and can bear as many as 12 piglets each time, which she is able to sell for 2,000 PHP each. She earns at least 20,000 PHP in sales every 3 months.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Conchita is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more feed and clean grain for her hogs. She thanks God and you, in advance, for both a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her.

Conchita aims to purchase more hogs and grow her business. She also wishes to send her children to college. She prays for good health and a stable life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and purchase additional hogs for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Shika Jembe Group

texts.fr: Jadis, Godefroid pensait que l'agriculture était un pure esclavagisme; ses impressions ont changé depuis 2010 avec les formations qu'il a béneficiées des organisations tant locales qu'internationales. Depuis, il exploite plus de 4 ha, hérité de ses parents et remarque que malgré quelques pertes qu'ils essuient, la terre est toujours là et l'activité est durable. Cela étant, pour accroître sa productivité il lui faut assez de moyens qui lui permettraient, dans ses perspectives, d'emblaver plus de 2 ha afin d'y gagner plus d'argent; tout cela dans le but améliorer ses conditions de vie. En guise de remerciement, Il encourage les initiatives aidant les gens à se relever...Sur la photo, Godefroid tient dans sa main un carnet.
texts.en:
Godefroid used to think that farming was pure enslavement, but his feelings have changed since 2010 following the training he received through local and international organisations. He now has more than 4 hectares inherited from his parents, and he feels that despite the losses suffered from time to time, the land is there and the activity is sustainable. 

To increase productivity, however, he needs to be able to have more than 2 hectares sown in order to bolster his revenue; this would help to improve his living conditions. 

Godefroid is thankful, and he encourages initiatives that help people to support themselves. He is holding a booklet in the photo.

loans.use: to handle transplants, and to buy base dressing and surface fertilizer.

loans.name: Wanaume Ni Kazi Group

texts.fr: Gilbert fait partie du groupe WANAUME NI KAZI et y assume la responsabilité. Il est agriculteur depuis son jeune âge. Ce champ lui a été léguer par ses parents et il le cultive actuellement avec son épouse. Ses activités champêtres lui procurent beaucoup de joie avec une saison culturale de courte durée et lui permettent de gagner sa vie. Il éprouve des difficultés dans le paiement de la main d'oeuvre pour le labour ainsi que l'acquisition des engrais; cela fait la raison de sa demande de prêt. Il estime dans l'avenir pouvoir emblaver d'autres espaces par l'achat ou la location de terres, assurer la  scolarité de ses enfants et préparer la dot pour ses futures belles-filles. Gilbert est parfaitement reconnaissable sur la photo car il a la main levé avec dans sa main un carnet rose.
texts.en:
Gilbert is part of the group called Wanaume Ni Kazi and has assumed responsibility for it. He has been a farmer since he was very young. The field was left to him by his parents and now he farms it together with his wife. 

His farm work, with a short growing season, brings him a lot of happiness, and it permits him to earn his living. He experiences difficulties paying his help, hired for preparing the land, and buying fertilizer. This is why he is asking for a loan. In the future he believes he can incorporate other plots of land by either buying the land or renting it so as to ensure that he can keep his children in school and prepare a dowry for his future daughters-in-law. 

Gilbert is easy to recognize in the photo because he has his hand raised, holding his pink notebook.

loans.use: to pay for weeding and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a 54-year-old, female Ugandan, married to John, and, together, they have five children, aged between 25 and 15 and only two are attending school. She also has three grandchildren.

Resty is a businesswoman who operates a retail shop, but she also is engaged in agriculture to supplement her retail shop.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited to buy merchandise for her retail shop, which she has been running since 2009. She hopes this will increase her sales and profit. She appreciates the work of the Kiva lenders.

Resty dreams of expanding her business, but she says her main challenge is the lack of sufficient capital, which she will be overcoming soon.

loans.use: to buy household-use items to sell, like corn flour, sugar, bread, and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to do transplanting and weeding for his rice crop.

loans.name: Filipe Riz Group

texts.fr:
Commerçant qui s'est converti en riziculteur depuis 1975, Kalembire est membre du groupe FILIPE RIZ dans laquelle il assume la fonction de président. Grâce aux sacrifices consentis avec son épouse, ils ont acheté un champ et amélioré leur habitat jadis en chaume. Toutefois, un apport en crédit lui sera très bénéfique étant donné que ses moyens sont extrêmement limités pour payer la main d'oeuvre, le sarclage puis s'en suivra un peu plus tard la récolte, emballage, tranport et entreposage. Il estime dans l'avenir étendre la surface culitivée jusqu'à exploiter un hectare de champ; une décortiqueuse à paddy lui fera aussi un grand bien car il lui permettra de réduire les charges liées au décortiquage qui lui coûtent chères: l'argent, une moitié de chaque kilo de riz ainsi que le son de riz.
Sur la photo (de gauche à droite), Kalembire est quatrième sur la ligne en chemise bleue fleurie en blanc.
texts.en:
Kalembire started working as a retailer but switched to rice farming in 1975.  He is a member and the president of the FILIPE RIZ group.  Thanks to some sacrifices that he and his wife have made, they were able to buy a field and improve their living conditions (they used to live in a thatched house).  However, Kalembire will still greatly benefit from a loan because he has very limited means to pay for labor, hoeing, harvesting, packing, transportation and storage.  In the future, Kalembire is thinking of increasing the size of his arable land up to a one-hectare field.  A Paddy Huller would also prove useful, as it would reduce the very high expenses related to hulling (he currently pays half the price of a kilo of rice and rice bran).
In the photo, Kalembire is standing fourth from the left, wearing a floral white and blue shirt.

loans.use: to hoe his plot of land and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Umoja Agri Riz Group

texts.fr: Président du groupe UMOJA AGRI RIZ, Mazeze s'est engagé dans les travaux champêtres depuis son jeune âge. Il a d'abord commencé  par accompagner ses parents; ces derniers lui ont soutenu jusqu'à l'acquisition de ses propres champs en 1980. Les difficultés majeures se présentent pour la paie de la main d'oeuvre après les travaux de sarclage et de récolte; toutefois, il est sans ignorer que les revenus de son labeur prennent en charge ses besoins familiaux. Il souhaite que son travail soit renforcé afin d'assurer de mieux en mieux la scolarité de ses enfants et aussi unn appui extérieur pour l'aider à se développer. Sur la photo, Mazeze tient dans l'une de ses mains un carnet rose.
texts.en:
Now president of the group called Umoja Agri Riz, Mazeze has been engaged in farming since he was a young man. He began by accompanying his parents who supported him until he was able to acquire his own fields in 1980. 

His major difficulty is to pay laborers for weeding and harvesting. However, he is certainly aware that the income from his work covers his family needs.  He would like his work to be more productive so as to cover his children's school fees better and also to have an outside support to allow him to develop. In the photo, Mazeze is holding a pink notebook in one hand.

loans.use: to pay for harrowing and transplanting his rice crop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for weeding and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley es una mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera, madre de cuatro hijos de ocho, cuatro, dos y un año, y su negocio es la venta de comida típica.
Ella es emprendedora, fuerte, constante, trabajadora, buena madre y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por su gigante crecimiento poblacional debido a la llegada de tribus nómadas del oriente (Ayoreos) y mineros relocalizados de occidente, de clima cálido tropical, con temperaturas que oscilan entre 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año
Shirley es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el guaraní y aprendió el español en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza sin pareja y con sus cuatro hijos, el mayor estudia en la escuela, y viven en la casa de su abuela construida de ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz. Su negocio es la venta de comida típica a diferentes horas del día, por la mañana se encarga de la venta de humintas (choclo molido con queso envuelto en su chala), a medio día se ocupa del masaco (yuca aplastada con queso), y por las noches prepara los ingredientes para las comidas del día siguiente. Su negocio lo realiza en su domicilio para ofrecer la comida caliente para llevar o comer al paso. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en dos años que viene realizando este negocio. Ella sueña tener su negocio propio. Y desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de una heladera para poder guardar los alimentos perecederos y tener más tiempo para ofrecer otra comida por las noches, de esa manera mejorarían sus ingresos y pagaría los gastos de sus hijos con mayor comodidad.
Es por esos motivos que Shirley solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de una heladera para pagar los gastos de sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Shirley is 30 years old and is the single mother of four children who are 8, 4, 2 and 1 year old. Her business is selling typical food. She is enterprising, strong, tenacious, hard-working, very responsible and a good mother. She works in the Plan 3000 zone, a place characterized by tremendous growth in population due to the arrival of nomadic tribes from the east (Ayoreos) and relocated miners from the west. It has a warm, tropical climate with temperatures that vary from 27 to 32 degrees centigrade year round. Shirley has a dark complexion, is of medium height, and has long, black, braided hair. Her mother tongue is Guarani and she learned Spanish in the city. She has no life partner and lives in her grandmother's house with her four children.  The eldest goes to school. The house is made of brick and has running water and electricity. 

She sells typical foods at different times of the day. In the morning she sells humintas (a type of tamale - ground corn with cheese wrapped in its husk); at noontime she sells masaco (crushed yucca with cheese formed into balls); and at night she prepares the ingredients for the next day's meals. She sells out of her house so she can sell the food hot for take out or to eat on the run. 

She has been running this business for two years but this is her first loan sequence with the lender. She dreams of having her own business and would like to expand her business by buying a refrigerator to store her perishable foods. This will give her more time to sell other foods at night. In this way she will be able to increase her income and pay her children's expenses more easily. This is why Shirley is asking for a loan  - so she can expand her business with the purchase of a refrigerator and then have the money to pay the expenses of her 4 children.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El socio Marco Antonio pertenece al banco comunal Chaska ñahuil socio es contador de profesión, el socio lleva buen tiempo ejerciendo su carrera el cual le va bien gracia al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio continua llevando la contabilidad de una empresa privada, a la vez el socio se dedica  a la venta de chocolates, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de chocolates.
El socio agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Marco Antonio belongs to the community bank Chaska ñahui. The member is an accountant by trade, and has been working in this field for some time. His career has been going well thanks to the effort he puts forth every day in his work. He continues to keep the books for a private business, while also working in the sale of chocolates. The member wishes to continue working in this manner to keep supporting his family. He requests this loan to purchase chocolates. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make prompt loan payments.

loans.use: to buy chocolates.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is twenty-four years old, married, and has two children - one of whom attends school. 

Vincent operates a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as sugar, salt, and soap, among other items. He desires to one day expand his business into a wholesale operation and be able to educate his children. 

Vincent will use this loan facility in order to buy more sugar and salt to stock in his shop.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a hardworking man who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He has a shop where he sells phones and their accessories. Gerald is married with 5 children, 3 of whom attend school. 

Gerald also does farming to generate more income. He wishes to one day build a permanent house for his family. 

However, Gerald is currently challenged by inadequate capital. He is requesting a loan in order to buy phones to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy phones to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Juana Del Tráncito

texts.es:
Juana de 35 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta bachillerato, vive con su madre quien depende de ella. Juana es comerciante, se dedica al comercio de ropa tiene más de 6 años dedicándose a este negocio que lo inicio motivada por una tía que también se dedicaba a esto y le dejo el puesto. Todos los día camina un kilómetro para llegar a su trabajo su horario es de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm.
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ropa de todos los estilos y tamaños, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, blusas, ropa interior y demás, le ha ido muy bien últimamente y aun no es la mejor temporada, quiere aprovechar el tiempo que se acerca y tener abastecido su negocio.
Juana espera Dios le regale vida para seguir trabajando y mantener a su madre.
texts.en:
Juana is 35 years old, single, and does not have children. She studied until high school and she lives with her mother, who is dependent upon her. Juana is a tradeswoman; she makes her living selling clothing and she has been in the business for more than six years. She began the business motivated by her aunt, who also made her living this way and gave Juana her position.

Everyday, Juana walks a kilometer to get to work. Her schedule is from 7:00 am until 5:00pm.

The loan will be used to buy clothing of all styles and sizes, including pants, shirts, dresses, blouses, underwear, and more. The business has gone really well for her lately and even thought it's not the best season, she wants to take advantage of the coming season and prepare her business. Juana hopes that God will give her life to continue working and take care of her mother.

loans.use: to buy clothing of all styles and sizes: pants, shirts, dresses, blouses, underwear, and more.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 47 years old, is married with three children, ages 24, 21, and 17 years. All three attend school at the moment. 

George sells clothes to earn an income. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (two million shillings only) to buy clothes for his business. 

He started business in the year 1998 to earn income to support he and his family. He is a hard-working man who works 12 hours a day, six days a week. He does business from Cell B Ishaka district and his customers are all categories of people.  

George's future plan is to be financially stable, buy a car, and educate all his children. He is faced with the problems of competition and price fluctuation for his business, but hopes to do well after getting the loan money.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kabako Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  KABAKO est constitué de  7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier   DIOUTIEBOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de condiments à l’image de SIRA qui est la 2ème femme assise dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1carton de cube maggi, 3 sacs d’oignons et 2 sacs de potirons avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
NB/  DIATOU est absente de la photo pour raison de maternité.
texts.en:
Kabako Group is made up of seven married women who average 35 years of age and 5 children each. They live in extended traditional families in Dioutiebougou, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni.

They got to know each other through bonds of community, friendship, and business. To strengthen their financial capacities and improve their business, they joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their fourth loan. The previous three loans were repaid completely.
 
The women in this group sell condiments, just like Sira, the woman sitting second from the left in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 1 box of "Maggi" bouillon cubes, 3 sacks of onions, and 2 sacks of pumpkins from wholesalers in Bougouni.

She retails at the market and at her home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed gender clientele. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000, to used in part to invest in her business, and in part to repay the loan.

Note: Diatou is not on the photograph for maternity reasons.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of "Maggi" bouillon cubes, 3 sacks of onions, and 2 sacks of pumpkins

loans.name: Hairullo

texts.ru: Хайрулло молодой мужчина в возрасте 29 лет. Хайрулло женат и имеет троих детей на иждивении. Хайрулло живет в сельской местности и занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота.  Хайрулло занимается животноводством с раннего детства и по сей день. Это его основной источник дохода. Хайрулло решил сделать ремонт и установить окна и двери из дерева  но  финансовое положение у Хайрулло сейчас не очень стабильное.   Специалисты рекомендовали ему купить  рамы для окон и доски для дверей. Чтобы установить  двери из дерева и купить рамы  Хайрулло обратился в Арванд и получить зеленый кредит для этого. Хайрулло очень обрадовался, что специально для этого существует продукт «зеленый кредит».
texts.en: Hairullo is a young 29-year-old man who is married and providing for three children.  He lives in a rural area and fattens cattle for a living; he has raised livestock ever since he was a young child, and it's his main source of income.  Hairullo has decided to renovate his home by putting in wooden windows and doors, but as his current financial situation isn't very stable, he sought advice from specialists at Arvand, who recommended he put in wooden windows and doors and take a green loan to do so.  Hairullo is glad that this type of loan exists for cases like this.

loans.use: buy wooden frames for putting in windows

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de pagnes à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la 1ère femme assise dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 6 pièces de pagnes  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Djiguisseme Group is made up of four married women who average 30 years of age and 5 children each. They live in nuclear families in Heremakono Nord, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni.

They got to know each other through bonds of community, friendship, and business. To strengthen their financial capacities and improve their business, they joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their fifth loan. The previous four loans were repaid completely.
 
The women in this group sell "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), just like Kadiatou, the woman sitting on the left in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 6 lengths of pagne from wholesalers in Bougouni.

She retails at the market and at her home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed gender clientele. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000, to used in part to invest in her business, and in part to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 6 lengths of "pagne" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia, en una aldea del Municipio de Gracias Lempira.  Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz  y hortalizas.  Y hace mas de 12 años se ha dedicado al cultivo de café, el cual vende en oro en la misma zona a los intermediarios, este café es cultivado en un terreno  de su casa. él quiere  mejorar la producción de café y decidió solicitar un préstamo por 18,000 Lempiras, el cual invertirá en la compra de abonos e insumos y un vivero para sembrar más plantas de café. Sus sueños son ampliar la finca de café y certificarla, darle estudio a sus hijos y darle calidad de vida a toda su familia.
texts.en:
José, 44, is married and has three children.  He lives with his family in a community in the town of Gracias, Lempira.

He has always earned a living in agriculture growing corn and vegetables.  For the last 12 years he has also grown coffee, which he sells in parchment to intermediaries in the same area.  He grows this coffee on a plot of land at his house.

José wants to improve his coffee crop, so he decided to request a loan for 18,000 lempiras [HNL] to invest in buying soil amendments, agricultural inputs, and a nursery to grow more coffee plants.

His dreams are to expand his coffee farm and certify it, provide his children with an education, and give a good quality of life to his entire family.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, agricultural inputs, and a nursery to grow more coffee

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Maria Esperanza es una mujer emprendedora y tiene la edad de 47 años, casada, madre de cuatro hijos quienes son su deseo de superación para seguir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta comida en su domicilio desde hace cinco años quien se ha dedicado por mantener y aumentar el crecimiento de su negocio. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de pollo, carne, frutas, verduras, gaseosas, vasos, platos, mesas, manteles, granos básicos etc. La socia lleva 18 ciclos financiados por la institución ADIM y ha logrado aumentar la demanda y mejoramiento del hogar. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en los días de pago.
texts.en:
Doña María Esperanza, 47, is an enterprising woman.  She is married with four children, who are the reasons that she wants to succeed.  She has been selling food in her home for five years; and she has devoted herself to maintaining and increasing the growth of her business.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of chicken, meat, fruit, vegetables, soft drinks, glasses, plates, tables and tablecloths, basic grains, etc.  She has completed 18 loan cycles with ADIM, and she has been able to increase her customer demand and improve her home.

She has shown that she is a person who is responsible and honest with her payments.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, meat, fruit, vegetables, soft drinks, glasses, plates, tables and tablecloths, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various school and office supplies needed in her store. Through her earnings she is able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more school/office supplies such as bond papers, pen, stapler, cartolina, ink, and other stuff needed in her store. She knows that the more items in her store, the more her sales will be. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her child. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Belen dreams of having another supplies store near a school. She wants to send her youngest child to finish school until college to ensure her a good future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for school/office supplies to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Beatrice, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 39 years old, is married and has 4 children. Beatrice has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Beatrice isn't new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Beatrice will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Beatrice's Group will purchase a total of 12 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Adelide's Group

texts.en:
Adelide's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Adelide, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. Adelide has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Adelide isn't new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, Adelide will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Adelide's Group will purchase a total of 6 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 48-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jane has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Jane described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Jane’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is a 60-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Florence has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Florence described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Florence’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Kalo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KALO est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  NIEBALA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 6ème prêt. Les 5 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce   de friperies à l’image de AWA qui est la femme assise devant dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 balle de friperies avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Group Kalo is composed of five married women; they are on average 35 years old with five children. They live in nuclear families, in the city of Bougouni’s Niebala neighborhood.

They met through neighborly, friendship, and trade relations. To increase their financial capacity and develop their business, they joined micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their sixth loan. The previous five loans have been repaid without issues.

This group trades in second-hand clothing, as illustrated by Awa, the woman sitting in the front in the photo. With her loan, she is planning on purchasing one bundle of second-hand clothing from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells from home and at the market to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and offers payment facilities.

She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business once the loan is repaid.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a builder by trade who constructs houses. Recently, Abraham started a car washing bay in order to generate more income. 

Abraham is requesting a loan to buy a car wash machine, which will not just make his work easier. Because he currently faces the challenge of few customers, he believes the machine will also make his service faster, thereby attracting more customers and increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy a car wash machine.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey lives in Masindi, Uganda. He has been a teacher in a primary school for three years. His fellow teacher inspired him to join teaching since he could earn a living. Geoffrey sells produce such as beans and maize to supplement his income. In doing this, he meets a hardship of unpredictable weather changes. He wants a loan to buy produce like maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy produce like maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 29-year-old male who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He has been in teaching service for 4 years. He started farming to generate other income and be able to sustain his home. 

He needs a credit facility to pay for labour to weed his garden. He complains of seasonality changes.

loans.use: to pay for labour to weed his garden.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 33 years old and married with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Annet sells fresh foods such as matooke, tomatoes, and others. She also owns a retail shop of general merchandise for selling to earn a living. 

Annet is hard working with a dream of expanding her business into a supermarket. Annet is faced with the challenges of market competition and inadequate skills. 

Annet wants money to buy matooke (banana) for selling.

loans.use: to buy matooke (banana) for selling.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 30-year-old hardworking woman who needs a loan to buy iron sheets for her house. She lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. 

She has been teaching for 16 years in a primary school to earn a living. She does farming to boost her income for the family. Her biggest challenge is low and delayed salary payment.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for construction.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is 30 year old and married with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. Noah operates a retail shop of general merchandise to earn a living. Noah is also a teacher by profession, which is where he gets additional income for his family. 

Noah has a dream of locating his business into a busy center. However, he faces a challenge of high transport costs and market competition. Noah wants money to buy sugar, maize flour, rice, sodas, and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, rice, sodas, and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Ululima

texts.en: Ululima is 29 years old and unmarried with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Ululima needs a loan to buy new boots, a crowbar, chemicals, fertilizer, crops and a new wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Ululima will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new boots, a crowbar, chemicals, fertilizer, crops and a new wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Leutu

texts.en: Leutu is a 48-year-old widow with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for nine years. Leutu needs a loan to buy two new wheelbarrows, three machetes, a spade, a shovel, chemicals and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Leutu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy two new wheelbarrows, three machetes, a spade, a shovel, chemicals and crops.

loans.name: Pina

texts.en: Pina is a 41-year-old unmarried woman with three children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Pina needs a loan to buy a new BBQ grill set, a gas oven, gas bottle, a new boiler, large pots and paper plates with forks and spoons. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Pina has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a new BBQ grill set, a gas oven, gas bottle, a new boiler, large pots and paper plates with forks and spoons

loans.name: Bebelu

texts.es:
Bebelu tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Bebelu se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, compra de insumos(harina, moldes, entre otros), dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio; Bebelu piensa tener mayor variedad de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Bebelu is 39 years old, she has a partner and one child. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Oyotun district, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. Her community works primarily in agriculture, livestock and business.

Bebelu makes a living baking and selling bread and has over ten years experience in this business, which is located in her home. She is requesting this loan to have working capital to buy supplies (flour, molds, etc). This investment will allow her to increase her sales with a great influence on the business. Bebelu would like to have a greater variety of products in order to accommodate the diverse needs, requirements and tastes of her customers in the area. This will allow her, in the short term, to increase her earnings and thus improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to have working capital to buy supplies. That investment will allow her to increase her sales

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa is a married woman with four children. She is 37 years old and all of her children are in school.

Dolorosa is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

Dolorosa has been in this business for 19 years. She would like to save enough money so that in the future she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old, married, with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Joseph is in motor vehicle transport and he also practices farming, growing crops such as maize ,rice, beans, and others to get a side income. 

Joseph has a dream of buying a new car. However, he is faced with a challenge of limited capital and bad roads that make him to spend a lot of money on repairs. 

Joseph wants money to repair his car and provide general maintenance.

loans.use: to repair his car and provide general maintenance.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Lolita is borrowing PHP 3,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 61-year-old hardworking man. He is married with six children, and three attend school.

He runs a primary school and earns a salary to cater for the family. He started the school so as to support their well-being. He started poultry farming so as to earn more income.

He wants a loan to be able to pay salaries and buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to pay salaries and buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Maedie

texts.en:
Maedie is 25 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maedie is borrowing PHP 4,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maedie has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en:
Vasati is a 44-year-old woman who is married with 6 children. She owns a beautiful resort at her village, catering to traveling tourists heading over for holidays. She has been in this business for 5 years. Vasati joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

Vasati needs a loan to buy plywood for the ceilings, iron roofing sheets, a box of nails, timber, bags of cement, and cans of paint. She will use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses and also to help expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy plywood, iron roofing sheets, a box of nails, timber, bags of cement, and cans of paint

loans.name: Tito

texts.es: Tito esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive con sus suegros en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Tito se gana la vida como chofer de trufi y quiere un prestamo para la conversion de su vehiculo de gasolina a gas o GNV, esto con el fin de poder ahorrar dinero Tito es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud por lo que necesita el credito
texts.en: Tito is married and has two children. He lives with his in-laws in a house made of bricks and cement in La Paz; the house belongs to his family. Tito makes a living as a taxi driver and wants a loan in order to convert his car from a petrol-run vehicle to one run on compressed natural gas. By doing this, Tito can save money. Tito is the only money-earner in his household but he is in good health and needs this loan.

loans.use: to convert his car from a petrol-run vehicle to one run on compressed natural gas.

loans.name: Pemita

texts.en:
Pemita is a 41-year-old woman who is married, with four children. She owns a large cattle farm and also has a plantation where she gets some extra money from. She has been doing this for more than eight years. 

Pemita needs a loan to buy rolls of barbed wire, a new chain saw, five young calves, chemicals, and a wheelbarrow. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Pemita joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of barbed wire, a new chain saw, five young calves, chemicals, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Geozel

texts.en:
Geozel is a married woman with three children. She is 25 years old and two of her children are in school.

Geozel is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Geozel has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so that in the future she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Junela

texts.en:
As a parent of 5 children, Junela works hard to support her family.

Junela has a fish vending business in the Philippines. However, she also earns additional income from food vending. 

Junela is borrowing 4,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell from her fish vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities with support from her past loans from NWTF. 

Junela hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra used the previous loan to buy land. He is twenty-four years old, married with three children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Ezra works very hard to put food on the table for his family. He has a dream of buying a bigger plot of land for farming. However, he is faced with a challenge of market competition.

Ezra wants money to buy materials for making men suits.

loans.use: to buy materials for making men's suits.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 23 years old now.

Marjorie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 3,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy buckets of fish to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy buckets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 61 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Nenita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase buckets of fish to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business so she can secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase buckets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба живет в сельской местности,в далёком от города поселке. Она имеет пятнадцатилетний опыт в сфере производства хлеба булочных изделий. Её мама была пекарем и она с детства была увлечена её работой. Она помогала маме и постепенно самостоятельно стала заниматься этим делом. Насиба замужем и имеет 3 детей. Её муж сезонно ездит в Россию на заработки.Но так как он мало зарабатывает он не может покрывать все семейные расходы. Насиба помогает мужу содержать семью и работает в местной пекарне пекарем. Она работает усердно, но её доход достаточно только для проживания и для того чтобы покрывать ежедневные расходы.Она не может позволит себе делать большие покупки для улучшения жизненных условий.Насиба хочет купить мебель для дома,но так как финансовое положение не позволяет ей поэтому она обратилась в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом.На полученный кредит Насиба планирует купить мебель. Выражает благодарность Арванд за содействие и огромную роль в её жизни.
texts.en: Nasiba lives in a rural area in a small village far away from town. She has 15 years of experience making bread and baked goods. Her mother used to be a baker, and Nasiba got attracted to this line of work early one. She helped out her mother and eventually started working independently. Nasiba is married and has three children. He husband is a seasonal worker in Russia. However, his earnings are low and he is not able to provide for all family needs. Nasiba helps her husband support the family and works as a baker in a local bakery store. She works very hard but her income is sufficient only for day-to-day living expenses. She cannot afford large purchases for improving her life conditions. Nasiba would like to buy furniture for her home but her financial situation does not allow her to do so, which is why she has applied to the Arvand microfinance institution for a loan. Nasiba plans to use her loan to buy furniture. She thanks Arvand for its help that is of great importance in her life.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Malama

texts.en: Malama is 49 years old and married with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Malama needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new gloves, boots, overalls, a crowbar and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Malama will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new gloves, boots, overalls, a crowbar and a tiller

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is thirty-one years old, married with four children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Stephen used the previous loan to buy cassava flour and a weighing machine.

Stephen operates a retail shop of general merchandise to earn a living. He has a dream of extending his business into a busy center. However, he faces challenges of high transport costs, market competition, and limited capital.

Stephen is a hardworking man who will use the loan to buy sand and cement to plaster his house and kitchen.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to plaster his house and kitchen.

loans.name: Ronaliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ronaliza works hard to support her family.

Ronaliza has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending. 

Ronaliza is borrowing 4,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can purchase buckets of fish to sell from her fish vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities with help from her past loans from NWTF. 

Ronaliza hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase buckets of fish to sell

loans.name: Irma Mariela

texts.es:
Irma de 24 años de edad, está acompañada desde los 19 años  de edad y tiene 3 hijos de 4 años de edad y 6 meses. Estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica su pareja es agricultor, ambos se dedican a su familia y a mantener el hogar, nadie más vive con ellos.

Irma es comerciante, tiene 4 años de vender en un puesto ubicado en una zona céntrica en el mercado de la comunidad en el que vende pan y tamales, los tamales los hace ella pero el pan lo elabora otra persona y ella lo vende por lo que obtiene una comisión por la venta. También tiene un  negocio en el que vende de manera ambulante en que vende antojitos como pasteles de carne y panes con pollo, recorre cerca de 1km. Su horario de trabajo es de las  8:00 am hasta las 3:00 pm.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar medicina para su madre que se encuentra mal de salud, al no contar con nadie más ella tiene el deber de velar por su madre. Irma espera que su madre se mejore y siempre mantenga estable su negocio.
texts.en:
Irma, 24, has had a partner for 19 years and has two children, one aged 4 years and the other 6 months. She studied until grade 9. Her partner is a farmer. She lives with her children and partner and only her children depend on her.

Irma is a businesswoman. She's been selling bread and tamales at a kiosk located in the central area of the community market for four years. She prepares the tamales but the bread is made by someone else and she gets a commission for selling it. She also runs a business as an ambulant salesperson, selling snacks, like meat pastries and bread with chicken; her route is almost one kilometer. Her work schedule is 8:00 am to 3:00 pm.

The loan will be used to buy medicine for her mom who is in bad health. Since her mom can’t count on anyone but her she is obliged to look after her. Irma hopes that her mom will get better and that she herself will always have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her mother

loans.name: Ahmadali

texts.ru:
Ахмадали мужчина 62 лет. Он родился и вырос в сельской местности. Ахмадали семейный. Имеет 4 детей. У всех детей уже своя семья . У Ахмадали 8 внуков. У  них большая и дружная семья. Он очень любит проводить время со своими внуками. Ахмадали вот уже несколько лет занимается  выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культурой. Он имеет очень большой опыт в этой сфере. Кроме этого он занимается выращиванием крупно рогатого скота. Это также приносит дополнительный доход его семье. Он не просто выращивает КРС, а любит заниматься этим делом. Ахмадали говорит, что они не покупают молочные продукты в магазинах. Невестки готовят дома кефир, сметану, творог.
 Для посева  сельскохозяйственной  культуры Ахмадали нужны деньги. В связи с чем он обратился в организацию Арванд за помощью. Он надеется на поддержку и заранее благодарит Киву.
texts.en: Ahmadali is a 62-year-old man. He was born and grew up in a rural area. Ahmadali is a family man. He has 4 children. All of his children already have their own families. Ahmadali has 8 grandchildren. They have a big and friendly family. He really loves to spend time with his grandchildren. Ahmadali has been involved in growing agricultural crops for several years. He has an extensive experience in this area. Besides this, he is involved in raising cattle. This also provides an additional income for his family. He does not simply raise cattle, but loves this business. Ahmadali says that they do not buy dairy products in stores. His daughters-in-law prepare kefir, sour cream and farmers cheese at home. Ahmadali needs money to plant agricultural crops. Due to this, he came to the Arvand organization for help. He relies on the support and thanks Kiva in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: María Jose

texts.es: Doña Maria José es una mujer exitosa en su negocio, tiene la edad de 37 años, casada, madre de dos hijos quienes son su deseo de superación y se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalias y perfumes de manera ambulante desde hace siete años. Ella tiene ocho ciclos financiados por la institución ADIM logrando inversión y crecimiento del negocio aumentando sus ventas. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de pacas de ropa, blusas, pantalones, capris, talladores, sandalias de niñas y adultos y perfumes para damas y caballeros. Ha sabido aprovechar el financiamiento obtenido en la compra de variedades de productos en cantidades mayores, siendo una persona responsable y honesta en las fechas de pago.
texts.en:
Doña María is a woman who is successful in her business. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of two children, who are the reasons that she wants to succeed.  She has been selling clothing, sandals, and perfume, on foot, for 7 years.

She has completed 8 loan cycles with ADIM; and she has been able to accomplish investment and growth in her business, increasing her sales. 
 
The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of clothing bundles—blouses, pants, Capri pants, bras, sandals for little girls and adults, and perfume for ladies and gentlemen. 

She has known how to make the most of the financing that she has obtained, purchasing varieties of products in wholesale quantities; and she is responsible and honest with her payments.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, Capri pants, bras, sandals for little girls and adults, and perfume for ladies and gentlemen.

loans.name: Sepoima

texts.en: Sepoima, 41 years old, is single and has 3 children. She has a small farm where she raises pigs that she can sell in her community or to the public. She has been doing this for 3 years. Sepoima needs a loan to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, pig food and a new wooden tub for water. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Sepoima will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, pig food and a new wooden tub for water

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Wilder se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, desde hace 10 años, su servicios los presta en su distrito y alrededores; él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; mantenimiento de su moto y cambio de motor para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, así como también asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, lo que le permitará seguir generando ingresos para su gastos.
texts.en:
Wilder is a 41 year old single man who does not have any children. He lives in his family's home in a rural area of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. His community essentially works in agriculture, cattle raising and business

Wilder has worked for the past ten years, in his and surrounding areas, by offering his motorcycle taxi transportation services. He is asking for a loan to invest in his fixed assets; to do maintenance on his motorcycle and to change the motor to be able to give his customers better service, as well as to ensure that his means for work is functioning properly, which will allow him to continue generating an income to pay his expenses.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his motorcycle and to change the motor.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Cecilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 35 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been in her business for one year now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hermocelia

texts.en:
A married parent of two children, Hermocelia works hard to support her family. She has a processed food business in the Philippines and also earns income from raising pigs.

Hermocelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 3,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Hermocelia hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman with four children. She is 45 years old and three of her children are in school.

Julita is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials to use in her business.

Julita has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so that in the future she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to use in her business

loans.name: Flor Deliz

texts.es: FLOR DELIZ: Es una señora alegre y luchadora, originaria de Waspam, madre soltera de un hijo de 8 años que cursa su primaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a su hijo, desde hace 9 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en un punto estratégico del municipio de Waspam. Solicita su primer financiamiento para destinarlo un 30% a comprar productos para su negocio: Chiverías, granos básicos, sopas instantáneas, productos enlatados, papel higiénico, entre otros productos y un 70%    destinarlo a mejorar su vivienda. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto y un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Flor Deliz is a happy and determined woman from Waspam.  She's the mother of a child, 8, who's in elementary school.  She started a small grocery store in a strategic location in the town of Waspam nine years ago because she wanted to have her own source of income.

Flor Deliz is requesting her first loan.  She'll spend 30% on Chivería products, basic grains, instant soup, canned food, toilet paper, and other products for her business.

The other 70% is to improve her home.  Her dream is to have a house made of concrete and a prosperous business.

loans.use: to make home improvements and to buy Chivería products, basic grains, instant soup, canned food, toilet paper, and other products for her business

loans.name: Ieva

texts.en:
Ieva is from Vinogradiv. She sells men's and women's leather footwear at a local marketplace. Ieva works herself; she doesn't have any hired employees. She has been running this business for 20 years. At the moment, she's renting her vending facility. Ieva is a widow. Together with her daughter, she lives in a private house. Growing flowers is one of Ieva's favorite hobbies.

Ieva needs an additional 40,000 Grivnyas, to purchase men's leather footwear for retail sale at her vending location. Being an ambitious entrepreneur, Ieva is planning to continue expanding her trade. She will do this by increasing her merchandise and eventually opening a little store of her own. Ieva is planning to re-invest her income in her business, again.

loans.use: to purchase men's leather footwear for further retail sale.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felicidad is 43 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Felicidad has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for thirty years. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is a married woman with two children. She is 22 years old now and is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Anna Marie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

Anna Marie has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a married woman with seven children. She is 43 years old and three of her children are in school.

Annie is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

Annie has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so that in the future she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita is a married woman with nine children. She is 47 years old and four of her children are in school.

Genita is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish nets and other material to use in her business.

Genita has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so that in the future she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other material to use in her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 53 years old, is married and has six children, two of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 3 years, Gloria has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish nets and other materials to use in her business. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Herculana

texts.en: Herculana, 35 years old, is married and has five children, three of them in school. Herculana is in the agricultural business, raising cows in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins for her cattle. Herculana has been raising cows for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Herculana would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion, 48 years old, is married and has four children, two of them in school. Salvacion is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Salvacion has been in business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 39 years old and is married with 4 children. All of her children are in school, and Geraldine works very hard to provide for them.

Geraldine runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, etc.

Geraldine has already been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, 28 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 6 years, Maricel has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Rosita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia es Originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque, tiene 52 años de edad, ella se ha dedicado por más de 10 años a la venta de comida y gaseosas. Y el sueno de Natalia es comprar su comal para elaborar sus propias tortillas para la venta y así obtener más ganancia para ayudar a su esposo en el estudio de sus hijos. una buena referencia es que no tiene ningún crédito y esto la ayudara a poder cumplir con sus pagos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la elaboracion de refacciones.
texts.en:
Natalia, 52, is from the area of San Martín Jilotepeque.  She has earned a living for more than 10 years selling food and soda.  Her dream is to buy herself a "comal" [griddle] to make her own tortillas to sell.  That way she could earn more profit to help her husband with their children's education.

She's requesting this loan to buy merchandise to make snacks.  She has no loan, which is good because it will help her be able to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy food products to make and sell snacks

loans.name: Itiiti

texts.en:
Itiiti is 33 years old and married with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year.

Itiiti needs a loan to buy fertilizer, gloves, a tiller, a pitchfork, chemicals, crops, and overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

Itiiti will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gloves, a tiller, a pitchfork, chemicals, crops, and overalls.

loans.name: Yelizaveta

texts.en:
Yelizaveta works at a clothing factory in Beregovo, as a seamstress. She, her husband, and their 23-year-old son live in their own private house. Unfortunately, Yelizaveta's husband often drinks, which has taught Yelizaveta to always rely only on herself and make all decisions on her own. She is very hard-working, open-hearted, and sincere.

Yelizaveta needs 15,000 Grivnyas for home improvements. She plans to change three window frames (replacing them with new plastic ones), to change the front door and interior doors, and to remodel her kitchen. All these improvements will not only make her house more comfortable for living, but they will provide better insulation against loss of heat. This will eventually help Yelizaveta save on bills.

loans.use: to make her home more comfortable and energy-efficient

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is from Vinogradovo. She is 38, is married, and has two daughters. She owns a small private business that she has been running for about 10 years.

Yevgeniya is planning to invest 20,000 Grivnyas in remodeling of her house. She is planning to finish remodeling one of the rooms, as well as the kitchen and corridor. Yevgeniya is hoping to paint the walls, to lay laminate flooring, to paint the ceiling in the kitchen, and to buy and set up a kitchen wall cabinet. Yevgeniya is needing additional funding, because she wants to finish remodeling by the time winter gets here.

loans.use: to remodel her home

loans.name: Fua

texts.en:
Fua is a 60-year-old widow with 4 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community and has 1 year of experience with this business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

Fua has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar plant for his house

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Anabel has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her weaving business.

In the future, Anabel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a direct sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from providing manicures and pedicures. Gina is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of beauty products to sell for her business.
