texts.es: Silvia de 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija de 7 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados y colonias tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Silvia está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
37-year-old Silvia is a single mother who lives in her own house with her 7-year-old daughter. She works as a street vendor selling clothing in the different markets and communities. She has many continuous customers because of the quality of her clothing and the good prices. 

Silvia is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale women's and men's clothing to be able to keep selling and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing for women and men.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 70 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa e hija, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Segundo se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes en general, desde hace más de 10 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Además se dedica a la venta de comida al paso como ceviche y papa rellena. Segundo solicita préstamo para la compra de mercaderia como arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc para ampliar su negocio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 70 years old, married, and lives with his wife and his daughter in his own house in a large community in the urban area of Cayalti. He has been given good personal and professional references by his neighbors. His community is mainly involved in agriculture, livestock rearing, and commerce. It is located in the district of Cayalti, the province of Chiclayo, the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.
Segundo sells general household goods, and has done this business for more than 10 years from his own home. Additionally, he sells fast food such as ceviche and stuffed potatoes. Segundo is requesting a loan to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. to expand his business. This will allow him in the short term to improve his income and increase his profits, and finally improve the quality of life of himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, and oil in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and fertilize his cocoa crop.

loans.name: Fayzah

texts.en: Fayzah lives in Al Wihdat. She has been selling blankets and ready merchandise in her home. Her project started two years ago, and two of her family members also help her in the business. Her purpose of applying for the loan is to increase the quantity of blankets and ready-to-sell merchandise. Fayzah’s future plan is to develop her project and to open a shop for selling these item

loans.use: to increase the quantity of blankets and ready-to-sell merchandise.

loans.name: Hamdi

texts.en:
Hamdi wants to thank all of the lenders for his previous loan, which helped him to buy two musical instruments. He has been using his purchases in his performances and has been able to continue his business, which he loves and enjoys doing. Through his work, he has been able to provide enough income for his family as well as achieve financial stability. 

At this time, Hamdi is requesting a second loan, this time to repair some of his musical instruments that have become worn over time. He hopes that this loan will help him to continue providing quality performances at the celebrations for which he is hired and continue to help his business succeed. 

Hamdi is very thankful for both loans and appreciates the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair some of his musical instruments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise like music CD's, music videos and movies, MP3s, audio and video equipment, and video game consoles.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 1 años al venta de tortillas, tiene muchos clientes y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: The young woman has a blurred face in the picture because she is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has worked selling tortillas for a year. She has many customers and uses her earnings to pay her bills. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She would like to improve her home by building a wall around the perimeter in the place shown in the photo, but she doesn't have enough money which is why she's asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and to pay for the labor. She wants to do this so her family can live safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de condimentos,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este megocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de condomentos.La socia solicita  el credito para comprar condimentos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still working selling condiments. She sells from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She hopes to get ahead with this business. Her dream is to expand the business selling condiments. 

She is asking for a loan to buy condiments. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Maria Clemencia

texts.es:
María vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. María  es una señora de 45 años, vive sola en casa propia con su hija, ya que hace tiempo atrás ella se separó de su esposo.
María es una mujer con una gran fortaleza, ella ha trabajado muy duro por su hija, le ha dado todo lo posible para sus estudios y sacarla adelante. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa y de cosméticos, visita a su clientela todos los días, ya que no puede quedarse en casa sin poder traer algún ingreso a su hogar. 
María a pesar de no contar con un riñón superó esta prueba y salió adelante con el apoyo de su hija. Se siente muy agradecida por esta oportunidad de vida, por ello se dedica mucho por darle la mejor educación a su compañera de vida.
María acudió a la Fundación para poder obtener un crédito, con este pequeño crédito ella podrá comprar más mercadería ya que es una buena temporada para las ventas. Se siente feliz por el apoyo que Kiva ha brindado y por la oportunidad de crecer como microempresaria, con este negocio podrá salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city on the coastal region, which has nice weather. It is a very commercial city, and is considered to be a land port that unites the mountains and the coast. Maria is 45 years old, and she lives in her own house with her daughter, as she separated from her husband some time ago.
Maria is a woman of great strength. She has worked very hard for her daughter; she has given her everything possible for her studies, to be able to help her get ahead. Currently, she makes a living selling clothes and cosmetics. She visits her clients every day, since she cannot stay at home, and not bring any income.  
Maria, in spite of not having one of her kidneys, was able to overcome this challenge, and was able to move forward with the support of her daughter. She is very grateful for this life opportunity, so she is very dedicated to give the best education she can to her life companion.
Maria went to the Foundation in order to obtain a loan. With this small loan, she will be able to buy more merchandise, as this is a good season for sales. She feels happy about the support that Kiva has given her, and for the opportunity to grow as a micro entrepreneur. With this business, she will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and grow as a micro entrepreneur together with her daughter.

loans.name: Agron

texts.en:
Agron is 41 years old and the father of five children between the ages of 8 and 19 years old. He is a hardworking man, who wants to give his children a better future and living conditions. He works as a painter, working mainly on different businesses and homes when he has customer requests. 

In addition, he currently has one cow that he keeps to sell milk and the other diary products in his area. He is now requesting a loan to purchase a second milk cow to increase his profits. His goal is to give his children a better education and life. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a second milk cow to increase his profits from selling milk products.

loans.name: Agron

texts.en: Agron is 39 years old, married and the father of 4 children between the ages of 3 and 17 years old. In order to earn a living, he works as a taxi driver. When he first began his business, he started with a small and old vehicle but has been able to now use a luxury vehicle instead. This has helped him to be able to improve his business because of the level of comfort and security his vehicle provides. He has a lot of customers because of this and because he is very polite and has a pleasant personality. For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to repair his vehicle, specifically change the tires for the upcoming winter season and to service the vehicle. This loan will help him to be able to continue to provide quality and safety transportation for his customers and help him to continue to generate his income. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: repair his taxi vehicle, specifically change the tires for the upcoming winter season and service the vehicle.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is age 33, and married with six children ranging from 4 months to 16 years old. She owns a grinding machine that generates income for her, and she also earns additional income from farming. 

Her dream is to develop and expand her business, and also to pay school fees for her children. Justine will use the loan facility to buy a new grinding machine. She complains of seasonality changes as her major challenge.

loans.use: to buy a new grinding machine.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of five children, three of whom attend school. He deals in produce in Hoima, Uganda. He mainly buys and sells maize, rice, and beans, among others. He earns additional income from farming and tailoring. 

He hopes to grow and expand his business by owning a big produce store supplying the town through out the year. However, price fluctuations and unpredictable weather changes hinder his desires. Emmanuel will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Qendrese

texts.en: Qendresa is 24 years old and the mother of two children. For more than two years, she has been involved in an agricultural business of raising goats for milk and milk products to sell in her neighborhood to make a living. She has many customers that request her products and she is now requesting a loan to purchase more goats because she is unable to keep her supply up with the demand. She loves her work and selling different products from her goats and dreams of being able to expand her farm even more in the future. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more goats because to up with demand.

loans.name: Jeton

texts.en:
Jeton wants to thank all of the lenders for their support for loan he received in order to replace the windows and doors of his home. He is very grateful to have had the work completed before the upcoming winter season. Jeton was very satisfied with the loan process and the lenders from his first loan and is once again requesting a loan, this time for his car wash business.  

He is a hard working man who does a lot to support his family, working long hours and doing hard labor. He is very satisfied with his business and `because he is very well known in his area, he has many customers and much demand. He is now requesting a loan in order to purchase a new machine for washing with hot water. This will help him especially in the winter time. He would also like to renovate his car wash. He hopes in the future he will be able to further expand his business and is very grateful to KosInvest-Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for washing cars with hot water

loans.name: Mildren Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Mildren es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al negocio propio, vende lácteos como ser queso, mantequilla y también se dedica a la venta de tortillas, sus clientes principales son personas que habitan en la zona.
Doña Mildren esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de lácteos como queso, mantequilla, leche, quesillo, etc. y poder aumentar sus ventas negocio, tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y es por ese motivo que desea invertir más, espera que gracias a las ganancias que obtenga poder seguir adelante en su negocio y apoyando a su familia en el hogar.
Doña Mildren sueña con poder darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.

Danlí, Honduras – Octubre  2014
texts.en:
Mildren is an entrepreneurial woman and is dedicated to her personal business. She sells dairy products such as cheese and butter and also sells tortillas. Her principal customers are people who live in the area.

Mildren is requesting this loan to buy dairy products like cheese, butter, milk, soft cheese, etc. and to be able to increase her business’s sales. She has many orders for these products and it is for that reason that she wishes to invest more. She hopes that with the earnings she obtains she will be able to keep going forward with her business and supporting her family at home.

Mildren dreams of giving her gamily a better standard of living.

Danli, Honduras – October, 2014

loans.use: to buy cheese, butter, milk, soft cheese, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea ella es casada y tiene 55 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su  negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de lavandería, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Banco del Desarrolla". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Andrea is a 55-year-old member who is married and has six children. She works in her business selling food. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soup and chipped beef. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She's done this for eight years and it's going very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is asking for the loan to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

The members shown below the group photo took the photo after the meeting because they weren't able to attend due to work. The other members have businesses such as a laundramat, an internet business, a grocery store and a restaurant. 

The member is grateful to those who make up part of this dream and she promises to pay back her loan in the agreed upon term length.

loans.use: to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Donesa

texts.en:
Donesa is 32 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Donesa has a business manufacturing native mats in the Philippines. Donesa requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her native mat weaving business.

Donesa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Donesa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native mat making business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 60 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

Nelia has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Nelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 28 years old, and married with three children, ages 6, 3, and 2 and all attend school. He is a hardworking man who deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize and beans, and supplemented by income from farming. He hopes to expand his business, to become a popular supplier of maize in the whole town, and to educate all his children to attain a minimum qualification. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 36 years old and married with seven children.  With four children in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Erlinda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Muhamud

texts.en: Muhamud is a 30-year-old, married man with eight children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. His business is motorcycle transportation (boda boda). He is a very hardworking man who has managed to look after his family with the income he gets from this business. He has a cocoa garden at his home, which also fetches him some money. He is challenged bad roads and inadequate capital to expand his business. Muhamud needs a loan to buy a new motorcycle for business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Dinë

texts.en: Dinë is 34 years old, married and the father of 2 children, 3 & 5 years old. Since he is his family's main source of income, he works transporting wood for heating in order to make a living. When people purchase wood and need to have it delivered, Dinë is called to transport it. He also works on his land with his tractor. Dinë has been working in both of these areas of over 10 years now while his wife stays home to take care of the children and the house. Now, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new tractor for his work. The tractor would help him with both of his jobs, transporting and working his land and would help him to be able to generate even more income to support his family. He is grateful for the opportunity and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To purchase a new tractor for his work

loans.name: Maria Guillermina

texts.es:
Maria Guillermina tiene 67 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Maria Guillermina se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(gallinas, pavos, patos, entre otros), desde hace 08 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales comprando patos, gallinas, pavos, cuyes el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor diversidad de animales esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Guillermina, 67, is in a common-law marriage and doesn’t have any children in her care.  She lives in her own home in the rural area of the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru’s northern coast.  Her community is mainly engaged I farming, raising livestock, and trade.

Maria Guillermina has been engaged in breeding and selling farmyard animals (chickens, turkeys, ducks, and others) for eight years, and her business is located at her home.   She is requesting the loan for working capital because she wishes to increase and diversify her animal stock by purchasing ducks, chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs.  The loan will help her have a greater diversity of animals in order to increase her business, and meet her customers’ needs.  This will allow her to improve her income in a short time, increase her profits, and therefore, improve her quality of life and that of her family. 
.

loans.use: to increase her working capital as she wishes to increase and diversify her animal stock.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 59 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene 3 hijos, mayores de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de La Matanza. La vida en el lugar es tranquila sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, como sustento principal siembra y cosecha de banano, maíz, frejol caupí. Etc. Su comunidad está ubicada en distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Manuel es la producción y comercialización de banano, la actividad la realiza desde hace más de 10 años, la misma que la realiza en el sector Carrasco. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en su negocio de comercio de plátano como es abono, y mantenimiento del mismo. Comprará abonos, insumos necesarios para que su producción obtenga buena cosecha. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el negocio es una de las actividades principales como ingreso económico sus ventas son quincenales. Piensa trabajar invirtiendo en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan a un mediano o corto plazo aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 59 years old, married and has three older children. He lives in his own house with his wife in the district of La Matanza. Life there is calm and the people that live there work in agriculture and livestock. Their main source of income is seeding and harvesting banana trees, corn, cowpea beans, etc. His community is located in the district of La Matanza in the Morropón province which is on the north coast of Peru in the Piura region.

Manuel produces and sells bananas, which he has done for over 10 years in the region of Carrasco. The loan will be used to invest in his banana selling business and maintain the crop. He will buy fertilizer and other necessary products so that he will have a good harvest. The market is good because this is one of the main activities. His sales are bimonthly. He wants to invest in his business to earn a better income in the short term.

loans.use: to invest in his banana business and buy fertilizer and to maintain the crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Masar

texts.en: Masar is 25 years old and recently married. He is a very hardworking man who does a lot in order to earn a living. He keeps organic chickens that he raises and also sells their eggs. This is a family business and his mother works with him. Together they maintain their small farm. However, he has another job working in a restaurant as a waiter in order to add even more income to his family. His salary is low and he is not satisfied with the income he receives there, but he does also earn tips which helps. Now, he is in need of a loan in order to purchase more chickens and renovate his coop. He hopes in the future he will be able to further expand his farm and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and renovate his coop

loans.name: Nevruz

texts.en: Nevruz is a father of 3 children and comes from an Ashkali community.  In order to earn a living, he works as a technical worker in a primary school in his village. His salary is low and he works cutting wood to sell for heating in order to add more money to his income. Like most of the people that live in the Ashkali community, he lives in very poor and substandard living conditions. At this time, he is in need of a loan in order to purchase a new wood cutting machine. This loan will help him to be able to generate more income because he will be able to cut faster and better, making him more efficient and improving his quality. He hopes in the future to be able to improve the living conditions of his family and give his children a better education. He thanks all of the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a new wood cutting machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business to maintain her income and to grow a little more, this is why she requests support with a loan.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking single mother from Tangub. She is 43 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this.

Nora has signed onto membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Nora hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production).

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor que tiene una hermosa familia con la cual convive y es sustento de ella. El ha logrado su pequeño negocio con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, se encarga de proveer a algunas empresas con útiles de escritorio para sus oficinas, insumos de equipos de cómputo y otros, cuenta con una demanda favorable hasta el momento, es por ello que Juan Carlos desea invertir el crédito en comprar memorias externas y algunos artículos de computo para contar con mayor mercadería y así lograr aumentar sus ventas, ya que con ello obtendrá más ganancias.
Juan Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, el sueña con comprar su casa propia en un futuro si le sigue yendo bien en su negocio, y mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a hard-working and enterprising man who lives with and supports his beautiful family. He has created his small business with great effort and dedication. He is responsible for providing companies with office supplies, computer supplies, etc. for their offices. So far there has been a good demand for his services, which is why he wants to invest the loan in buying external memory devices and other computer supplies so he can offer more merchandise, thus increasing his sales and generating more income. 

Juan Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity. He dreams of buying his own house in the future if his business continues to be successful, and of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy external memory devices and other computing supplies to stock his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics for making clothes

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en: Yowasi is a 60-year-old, married man with thirteen children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop where he sells general merchandise, besides his cocoa garden that supplements his income. He started the business in 1979 and it has helped him to look after his family for all this time. He desires to build a permanent house. Yowasi wants the loan to buy general merchandise such soap, bread and mineral water to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell such soap, bread and mineral water.

loans.name: Gëzim

texts.en: Gezim is 33 years old, married, and the father of 3 young children. Based on his family tradition, he works in agriculture. Gezim is very hardworking and does much to provide for his family. He started working when he was 16 years old, working on land for others and harvesting various crops. He also works in construction when he has some work to do. Now, he is in need of a loan in order to purchase some additional tools for his tractor so that he can work more efficiently on the land. He believes that this loan will increase his income and appreciates all of the lenders. He promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To purchase some additional tools for his tractor so that he can work more efficiently

loans.name: Dúo Brisas De Barcenas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Brisas de Barcenas
Florinda Ella es madre de familia de hijos el cual trabaja arduamente para sacarlos adelante y ella empezó con una pequeña venta de golosinas y asi ella fue compareando mas producto para surtir su pequeño negocio y asi año con año fue aumentando y ella tuvo la ortunidad de conocer FAPE ella esta muy agradecida con la fundación por la confianza que le dieron al crecer su negocio y asi ella sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera y AGRADECE A DIOS POR ESTA GRAN OPORTUNIDAD  y ahora ya tiene una tienda en el que ha includido otras cosas para que siga creciendo y aumentando sus ganacias, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles.
texts.en:
Dúo Brisas de Barcenas Communal Bank
Florinda is a mother who works hard to get her children ahead.  She started with a business selling sweets, and as she went along she bought more products to stock up her small business.  Year after year she increased her stock, and then she was given the opportunity to learn about FAPE.  Florinda is very grateful to the foundation for the confidence they placed in her to grow her business.  She is getting her children ahead as a single mother.  And, she thanks God for this great opportunity.  Florinda now has a store that includes other items so she can keep growing and increasing her profits.  She is requesting this loan to purchase foodstuffs for resale.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Adelfa works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop.

Adelfa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock for her general store, like soft drinks, rice, spices, etc. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Adelfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell at her general store, like soft drinks, rice, and spices

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She has a direct-selling personal products business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Emma is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF. She will use it to purchase more personal products for her direct-selling business, like lotion and toothpaste. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan, to further build her businesses.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like lotion and toothpaste

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a fifty two year-old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop that sells general merchandise. He is a hard working man who loves his business and is engaged in cocoa farming to supplement his incomes. Juma is limited by capital yet he hopes to expand his business to new market areas. He wants a loan to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as curry powder and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jenny works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Jenny is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.
She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen products. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.
Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Antonia de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Antonia is 50 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. For various years she has had a business making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. She seeks a loan to buy corn by the quintal (46 kg) and lime in order to continue making tortillas and in this way be able to have greater income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal (46 kg) and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer for her hamburger business.

loans.name: Velen

texts.en:
Velen is from Tangub, Philippines. She is a single mother with two school age children. Velen is gaining a profit from her copra making business. She buys whole coconuts from her neighbors for this. She has had this business for 10 years, and it has supported their needs, especially her children's education. 

She requested a loan to purchase more inventories of whole coconuts to make more copra to generate higher income for her family. Velen has been a member of PMPC since 2013. In the future, she hopes to build a decent house for the family and wishes to improve their general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories of whole coconuts to make more copra to generate higher income for her family.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia Maribel tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera cuenta con estudios secundarios, vive en casa familiar de material rustico, vive con su hermana con quien comparte la vivienda. Sonia Maribel vive en la parte rural del distrito contando con servicios de luz y agua, su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Sonia Maribel es la cría de animales menores con una antigüedad de 4 años, el cual le genera ingresos para su subsistencia. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de animales menores para su cría y posterior comercialización, y con ello generar mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios y buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia Maribel is 33 years old, single and has a secondary education. She shares her family’s home with her sister, which is made of recycled materials. 

Sonia Maribel lives in the rural part of the district that has running water and electricity. Her community is primarily based on agriculture, ranching and commerce. It is located in the district of Pucará, Jaén province in the northerly Andean region of Cajamarca in Peru. 

Sonia Maribel raises young animals under 4 years old, which generates revenue for her subsistence. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of young animals to raise and later sell. With this she will generate greater revenue and improve her quality of life. For this line of work there is no increased competition in the area and with it she can receive better prices and greater profits.

loans.use: to buy young animals to raise and later sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients like meat, fish, eggs, canned goods, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Marissa has been in this business for 12 years. She also earns more income from a general store. Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more  ingredients like meat, fish, eggs, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell in her fish business.

Rosemarie successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Genela

texts.en:
Genela is 53 years old and married, with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, a business she has been in for six years. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like coffee, soft drinks, juice, and noodles.

In the future Genela would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like coffee, soft drinks, juice, and noodles.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gideon, 51 years old, works hard to support his family. He has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and he earns additional income by selling nipa roofing.

Gideon is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. He will use this amount to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle that he uses in his transport business.

He has been sustaining his business activities through his past 12 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream, to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his business motorcycle.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 62 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like milk, canned goods, eggs, etc. Vicenta has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like a fishing net and other fishing equipment. Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like a fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy lives in Hoima Uganda. She is 38 years old, married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of seven children of ages ranging from 5 to 21 years old, four of which attend school. She runs a retail shop mainly selling cooking oil, sugar, salt and soap among other items. She earns additional income from selling local alcohol called waragi. She hopes to expand her business as well as educate her children. She will use the loan to stock more salt and soap for sale.

loans.use: to stock more salt and soap for sale

loans.name: Melgina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Melgina works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Melgina is borrowing 7,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her manicure and pedicure service business.

Melgina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Elina Selineth

texts.es: ELINA SELINETH: Es una señora amable, originaria de Rosita, tiene 34 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 12 años que estudia su primer año de secundaria y una pequeña de 2 años. Su esposo es motocierrista. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace un año vende ropa nueva de varones y mujeres de manera ambulante y por encargo. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua: Botas para hombres, pantalones de mujeres, camisas. Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones adecuadas a su familia.
texts.en:
Elina Selineth is a kind woman from Rosita.  She is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  The oldest is 12 years old and in his first year of secondary school.  The little one is two years old.  Her husband is a lumberjack.  In order to have her own source of income, she has been selling new clothes for men and women for one year.  She sells in an itinerant manner and by order.

She is requesting her first loan to buy men’s boots, women’s pants, and shirts in Managua.  

Her dream is to have a house that provides adequate living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy men’s boots, women’s pants, and shirts.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 19-year-old single man from Deir Al-Balah. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a small income. Six months ago, Tareq bought a rickshaw and started working with it. He buys goods from wholesalers and then sell them to local traders.

Tareq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products at lower prices so he can sell them to the traders in the market. By taking this loan, Tareq will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

Tareq appears in the photo with his new rickshaw.

loans.use: to buy more products at lower prices so he can sell them to the traders in the market

loans.name: Sonia Griselda

texts.es:
La señora Sonia tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, vive con su esposo en una aldea de Trojes, su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar cómo ser: azúcar, arroz, manteca, jabón y refresco, cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad tiene una buena clientela siendo estos vecinos de la misma aldea y comunidades aledañas.
Doña Sonia esta solicitando el  préstamo para la compra de azúcar, arroz, harina, huevos, mantequilla, refrescos, etc. y  tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, lo que le permita mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Sonia su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida.


Trojes, Honduras - Octubre 2014
texts.en:
Sonia, age 37, has two children.  She lives with her husband in a village in Trojes.  Her business activity is selling basic needs products like sugar, rice, shortening, soap, and soft drinks.  She has been doing this type of business activity for ten years.  She has good clientele, who are her neighbors from her village and surrounding communities.

Sonia is requesting the loan to buy sugar, rice, flour, eggs, butter, and soft drinks, etc.  She will do this to have better stock in her business.  This will allow her to improve her income in order to cover the family expenses and financial commitments.  

Sonia’s dreams are to give her children a good professional education and to improve their living conditions.

Trojes, Honduras – October, 2014

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, eggs, butter, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Phearum

texts.en:
Phearum is a 19-year-old single freshman at a university in a city and his major is Information Technology. He is from the Tbong Khmum province of Cambodia.

Because of a lack of financial support to pay his tuition fees, he has decided to secure a loan. With this loan, Phearum will be able to build his future dreams.

After graduation, he wants to find a job to save some money and then run an IT center.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and perform maintenance on his crops.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is 40 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jerlyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Jerlyn has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 44 years old and married with ten children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells pearls in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of pearls to sell.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for ten years and also earns an income from fishing.

Zenaida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of pearls to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a nipa-roofing-making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional nipa leaves, to weave into roofing panels that she will sell. Jennifer has been in this business for four years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa leaves, to weave into roofing panels

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 50 years old and married, and she works very hard to provide for her family.
She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, and sugar to sell.
Lorna has been in this business for three years.
In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Ever Grace Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ever Grace Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ever Grace Marivic is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ingredients like spices, meat, etc for her food vending business.

Ever Grace Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients like spices, meat, etc

loans.name: Agatona

texts.en:
Agatona is 54 years old and married with two children. She earns a living through her pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Agatona is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been in pig fattening for 25 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Agatona is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jovelly

texts.en:
Jovelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen foods, meat, etc. for her food vending business. Jovelly has been in this business for 9 years. Jovelly earns additional income from raising chickens.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods, meat, etc.

loans.name: Myrlyn

texts.en:
Myrlyn is 58 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods to sell.

Myrlyn has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Mary Lou is 45 years old and a widow with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Mary Lou has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Merly works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Merly is borrowing PHP 5,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell for her frozen foods business.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Bulgansaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bulgansaikhan, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a carpenter since 2006. His wife is currently studying at an agriculture university. Their elder son goes to school while their younger son is still in kindergarten.

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to pay tuition fees for his wife. If his wife successfully graduates from her university, the payoff will be big, as this will open the opportunity for his wife to secure a job for herself. If he and his wife work simultaneously, it is certain that his family's living standard will improve greatly.

loans.use: to pay his wife's tuition fees.

loans.name: Sawe Rahayu Indah Group

texts.en:
With the previous loan, the Sawe Rahayu Indah Group tried to change their efforts from pigs to crop seller, kiosk, services and selling religious articles. These proved to provide additional revenue for them. All of the businesses, the pigs program, and other businesses that they already had, can be done well. 

Now with the new loan, the Sawe Rahayu Indah group will try to develop their standard of living by adding other types of businesses such as travelling fruit seller, travelling clothes seller, and fast food seller. 

Ni Komang succeeded as a cake maker, and now she will use her loan to purchase more tools to make cakes such as a blender, a mixer and also some ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and chocolate. She sells the cakes to the kiosks around her neighborhood. With the additional income, she hopes she can improve her savings and have enough capital to continue the business with her own money.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to make cakes such as a blender, mixer, and ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, and chocolate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Orlinda Yasmin

texts.es: Orlinda de 56 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de cerdos, comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, Orlinda está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar concentrado y compra de mas cerdos y así poder continuar con la crianza y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Orlinda, 56, has operated an animal sales business for several years.  She raises pigs and sells them in different markets. Her income from the business helps to cover her family's everyday expenses.  Orlinda lives with her husband and son.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy pigs and feed for maintaining and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for her animal sales business.
